My work has ranged from computer vision stuff to GenAI applications, and I've even managed to get some research papers and patents out of it. üöÄ  Honestly, what gets me most excited is seeing how AI and product strategy come together. When I actually understand what users need and what business problems we're solving, I end up building way better ML systems. It's that sweet spot that really motivates me. üí°  Outside of work, I'm usually buried in a book üìö or binge-watching stand-up specials üòÑ. Good storytelling just hits different, you know? headline: Holistic well-being | Human Capital Consulting | Responsible Belonging and Inclusion
summary: - The views and opinions expressed in all posts are solely my own in my personal capacity. They do not represent, reflect, or purport to represent the views, positions, strategies, or policies of my employer, past or present, or any affiliated organizations. Nothing in this post should be construed as an official statement or endorsement. - I may be unable to respond to all DMs. Please excuse me if I am unable to. - I have reached the maximum number of connections allowed by LinkedIn, I request that you choose the "follow" option.   About me -  I lead Human Resources at Merck India, a leading Science and Technology company, with nearly 20 years of experience in HR and business leadership. I am passionate about driving transformative change and organizational success by crafting and executing strategies for sustainable growth and excellence.   My strategic approach to HR goes beyond traditional practices, as I align HR initiatives with overarching business objectives, creating a powerful synergy that elevates performance and fuels innovation. I have built high-performing teams that serve as catalysts for business growth in diverse industries and markets, leveraging my expertise in HR Strategy, HR Business Partnering, Talent Management, and Talent Acquisition. I am also a champion of Responsible Diversity and Inclusion, as I believe it is a strategic imperative that unlocks untapped potential and drives creativity and adaptability. In my current role, I am the country sponsor of the ‚ÄúI am Proud‚Äù ERG.   I hold a post-graduate degree in HR and L&D, and I am proud to be a Wharton School-certified expert in Talent Strategy. Additionally, my credentials as a  PROSCI change practitioner, and AON-certified Total Rewards specialist enable me to lead seamless organizational transformations. I am also active in working with colleges as a part of their board of studies and as a guest faculty, sharing my insights and best practices with the next generation of HR leaders.

Presently I am working as a Senior Technical Developer in DevOn software solutions with primary responsibility of building efficient and seemingly smooth web interfaces using react js.   As a React developer at Wisedrive Technologies Pvt Ltd, I spearhead the design, development, and maintenance of customer relationship management web apps. By incorporating agile practices and utilizing my expertise in JavaScript, Typescript, and ReactJS, I built a powerful module that leverages over 50 APIs to convert leads into sales. This resulted in a remarkable 20% performance enhancement for customer and service management. I take pride in collaborating with designers and backend developers to continuously optimize and revamp these apps, ensuring scalability and maintainability for future growth. I crafted advanced face liveness detection using JavaScript and the media pipe face mesh API, achieving an impressive minimum latency of under 50 milliseconds. Additionally, I successfully developed a full-stack automatic number plate detection web application within a tight 5-day deadline. headline: Director of Engineering (Platform, Cloud Infrastructure) at Tessell, Inc. | Founding Member
summary: In a career spanning more than 14 years, built several products and services for the cloud, storage & virtualization domains. Currently working as a Director of Engineering (Infrastructure & Platform Engineering), building the next-gen data management SaaS platform at Tessell, Inc.
position_description_1: Leading the Cloud Infrastructure & Platform Engineering team at Tessell.
position_description_2: Working as a Staff Engineer (Technical Lead) for the Cloud Mobility Services R&D team (Nutanix Move) at Nutanix, Inc.  - Leading the development of a multi-cloud VM migration platform. 250k VM migrations completed.  - Designed an agentless & incremental migration methodology for migrating Azure virtual machine workloads to on-premise AHV clusters.  - Boosted the migration throughput upto 7x on high latency, lossy networks by leveraging KCP, an opensource UDP based reliable transport protocol.  - Added protocol-agnostic stream multiplexing capabilities to the data transport pipe.  - Designed and developed the Nutanix Move microservice stack & application life cycle management (one-click upgrade) using Docker container ecosystem. 6k upgrades performed.  - Lead the design and development of Nutanix Move, a multi-cloud virtual machine migration solution which supports AHV, ESXi, Hyper-V, AWS & Azure platforms.  Technology Stack: Python, Go, SaltStack, Docker, VDDK, gRPC, AWS, Azure, ESXi, KVM
position_description_3: - Built a minimal Docker container host operating system based on Alpine Linux to ship Nutanix Move as a virtual appliance.  - Designed and developed a rules engine to programmatically define and predict workload requirements for database migrations (DB Xtract).  -Designed and developed core functionalities of a database migration solution which comprises of designer, deployer and migrator modules.  - Developed a task execution framework in Python with support for pause/resume/cancel operations and progress monitoring.  Technology Stack: Python, Go, SaltStack, Docker, VDDK, gRPC, AWS, Azure, ESXi, KVM
position_description_4: - Lead the design and development FitCheck, a cluster health diagnostics tool.  Technology Stack: Python, ESXi, AHV
position_description_5: Worked as lead developer in a team responsible for the development, testing and debugging of SAN & NAS data migration platforms.  - Developed data collection and reporting modules for the Inventory Collect Tool (ICT) used in 7-Mode Transition Tool (7MTT).  - Developed an XSLT based viewer for the inventory data collected by ICT.  - Reduced the overall memory footprint of the data collector module upto 3x and improved performance upto 2x.  - Developed a migration planner using PyQt to generate homogeneous & heterogeneous SAN migration plans which can be automated.  - Built a PyQt based interface for viewing and uploading data data collector bundle to a centralized NetApp filer.  Technology Stack: Python, PyQt.
position_description_6: Actively involved in the design and development of a cloud computing platform that can solve the problems of application scalability, availability and fault-tolerance.  - Developed core services and Google App Engine compatible APIs for a PaaS platform.  - Developed a FUSE file system for malware analysis, backed by Samba shares.  - Developed various modules and components of a virtualization platform (FluidVM) targeted at VPS hosting providers. Supports Xen, OpenVZ and KVM hypervisors.  - Developed HyperVM API emulator for the virtualization management platform.  - Developed a management console for data center administrators to manage the virtual machines remotely.  - Contributed to Hypertable Python client library development using boost-python.  Technology Stack: Python, C, XML-RPC, Protocol Buffers, FUSE, libvirt, Xen, KVM, OpenVZ, Hadoop/HFDS, RabbitMQ, Riak, Hypertable.

headline: Co-Founder and CTO - Shvasa
summary: An entrepreneur with a keen interest in product development, technology, marketing, education, and innovation.  Currently, Co-founder and CTO at Shvasa. On a mission to take authentic and holistic yoga to the world. Building world's best digital experience for yoga and fitness.   Founded Acadgild, an intensive online bootcamp, in 2015. Built it into a leading platform for acquiring skills. Acadgild has consistently been rated as top 10 technology bootcamps in world (https://www.coursereport.com/best-online-bootcamps). Grew revenues by 4x year-over-year. Raised multiple rounds of funding. Worked with investors as part of board.   Was directly responsible for product development, technology, course selection, and marketing. Led the development of Acadgild platform from ground up.   Prior to founding AcadGild, I worked as CTO at FlipClass, I was leading the development of next generation learning tools. Set up entire tech team at FlipClass. Built CRM from ground up. Built an AI based LMS. Also, set up tutor team and operations team.  Founder of one of India's most loved social movie rating site MOZVO. MOZVO does sentiment analysis for Bollywood movie tweets and presents an unbiased rating.  Conceptualized and implemented Mobile eCommerce platform for Qwest. Managing a team of 200+ high-performance individuals working on a wide array of technologies. Worked in different countries in critical roles.  Specialties: Technology especially eCommerce and Mobile related, Algorithms, Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning. Ideation, motivating teams and individuals to innovate, Conflict resolution and strategizing offshore-onshore engagement models.   Passionate about creating and learning. Have lead teams which have created massive platforms.

position_description_1: Worked on the end-to-end automation of the Release Order (RO) workflow for Instamart Ads at Swiggy. Implemented an AWS Lambda function integrated with Textract to parse RO PDFs uploaded by advertisers and store structured data in DynamoDB. Built a daily cron job in the Post-Serving service to validate RO limits by comparing the budget spent against active release orders for each advertiser. If the limit is breached, a Kafka event is published to trigger downstream email notifications. Designed and developed a Kafka consumer in ads-dsp that fetches user details via Ozone Admin API and sends branded emails using Swiggy's communication service. Also integrated Prometheus metrics for tracking cron executions, Kafka events, and error monitoring across the system.

summary: As a seasoned Blockchain Architect, Senior Engineer and Research Lead with over 6 years of experience in blockchain R&D, I specialize in architecting scalable and decentralized solutions that drive innovation in the Web3 space. My expertise spans Ethereum ecosystems, zk-Rollups, zkWasm, smart contract development, and cryptographic advancements like ZK-SNARKs and ZK-STARKs.  In my current role at aelf Blockchain, I lead research and development initiatives, design & develop cutting-edge ZKP-based authentication systems, zk-Rollups, Optimistic rollups and deliver workshops at institutions like Google Singapore and Microsoft Research India. My work consistently bridges the gap between advanced blockchain research and practical developer tools, empowering communities and organizations to adopt Web3 technologies effectively.  Previously, as a Founder and CTO, I designed innovative solutions like an account abstraction wallet leveraging ZKP-based identities for private transactions. headline: Leading engineering operations at Golgix, Inc.
summary: Hello! I'm a Full Stack Engineer with a passion for doing impactful work that helps organizations save costs and other engineers do their job better. Currently, I'm working with the core team in India for the Mercari C2C domain. My strengths lie in backend engineering, and I'm developing a growing interest in platform and infrastructure engineering.   As a solo Backend Platform Engineer at LILA Games, I optimized build pipelines, migrated infrastructure and architected and executed backend data flows in GoLang using the Nakama framework. At Mercari JP, as part of the Master User Team, I designed and managed microservices, migrated master endpoints to gRPC, and pioneered decommissioning unused microservices to save costs. I'm also a former Google Summer of Code Student Software Developer.   In all my work, I prioritize creating efficient solutions and improving documentation to help others work more effectively. I'm excited to connect and collaborate with fellow engineers who share my passion for impactful work!
position_description_1: As the Tech Lead of Engineering Operations, I am responsible for spearheading the strategy and execution of Golgix's cloud infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, and overall system and services reliability. My role is focused on building a scalable, secure, and highly automated foundation to accelerate development and ensure operational excellence.  Key Responsibilities:  - Infrastructure & Cloud Management: Leading the architecture and maintenance of our AWS infrastructure using Terraform, including managing EC2 instances, networking, IAM, and cost optimization. This involves championing cloud cleanup initiatives and migrating services to stable, custom DNS to enhance maintainability. - Automation & CI/CD: Driving the evolution of our automation and CI/CD practices by architecting and implementing CI pipelines for infrastructure, optimizing Docker build processes for significant performance gains, and developing more resilient build scripts. - Deployment & Release Engineering: Owning the end-to-end deployment process across numerous multi-client environments. This includes designing and refining proprietary tools to standardize releases and eliminate manual interventions. - Technical Leadership & Standards: Providing architectural guidance on new projects, enforcing engineering best practices for security and code quality, and mentoring team members. Acting as the central point of communication for all operational matters to ensure clear and consistent updates to all stakeholders. - System Reliability & Performance: Overseeing system monitoring, alerting, and performance diagnostics. This includes establishing robust logging with AWS CloudWatch and authoring comprehensive guides for diagnosing and resolving system-level issues to ensure high availability.
position_description_2: - Led backend architecture and hands-on development for Mercari‚Äôs Global One Product (GoP), designing BFF (Backend-For-Frontend) layers and critical microservices supporting international expansion and new product features. - Drove platform-wide infrastructure transformation with Terraform, Kubernetes (GKE), CUE, and Google Cloud Platform; rolled out universal authentication and internationalization (i18n) middleware adopted by 8+ development teams. - Built and launched core modules including Social features (likes, browsing history) and an Order Management Service, delivering extensible foundations for new and scalable user experiences. - Modernized master data delivery pipelines using active-passive DB patterns, CDN caching, and authored Python client libraries, dramatically improving reliability and enabling multi-language data consumption. - Enhanced system stability by engineering circuit breaker solutions for high-traffic services, proactively mitigating OOM risks, and redesigning CI/CD workflows for zero-downtime deployments. - Advanced engineering culture by establishing backend hiring assessments, improving developer workflows, and organizing regular knowledge-sharing sessions across teams.  Tech: Go (Golang), Python, gRPC, Protobuf, Kubernetes, Terraform, Docker, GCP, CI/CD (WarpSpeed CD, GitHub Actions), Microservices, System & API Design, Distributed Systems, Internationalisation, Authentication
position_description_3: During my time at LILA Games, I served as the sole backend and platform engineer, allowing me to expand my skill set and take on a wide range of responsibilities. One of my significant achievements was setting up an improved build pipeline that significantly reduced build time by over 50% by parallelizing cross-platform builds.  Another significant accomplishment was migrating infrastructure from various cloud providers to Google Cloud Platform services, including GKE, GCS, L4 Load Balancers, and others. I also created Git-versioned K8S and Terraform manifests as part of the process.  Working on all game features, I was responsible for designing and implementing the data flow in the backend using the Nakama framework and GoLang. Some notable systems that I created include missions, loot distribution, and character profiles.  Lastly, I was responsible for setting up analytics and LiveOps for the game. I used a combination of GCP tools, including Big Query, Data Flow, and PubSub, along with in-house backend interaction tools created using Retool to accomplish this task.
position_description_4: As a Backend Game Developer (Contractor) at LILA Games, I had the opportunity to work on Project BLACK, an exciting Loot & Survival game. I developed a scalable backend system using the Nakama framework, ensuring smooth and reliable gameplay for our players.  In addition, I set up efficient build processes and deployment pipelines using GitHub actions, Agones, and containerization. These improvements not only reduced costs but also increased QA cycles, allowing us to deliver high-quality content in a timely manner.  I optimized and designed database storage models, ensuring fast and efficient data retrieval for both authoritative and client queries. Additionally, I implemented player progression data storage, providing valuable insights to the game's design and balancing.  Overall, my experience as a Backend Game Developer at LILA Games allowed me to work on an exciting project while honing my skills in backend development, optimization, and database management.
position_description_5: During my internship with the Master User Team at Mercari Japan, I designed, developed and managed microservices of the Master domain to manage Master data such as ItemBrands, ItemCategories, and Configs, as well as Lottery service for campaigns. I contributed to the team in the following ways:  - Designed the migration of Master endpoints from PHP monolith HTTP endpoints to gRPC endpoints written in Golang, improving performance and scalability. - Spearheaded the decommissioning of unused microservices to save costs and prepared an organizational-wide process for safe and fast removal of unused microservices. - Developed the i18n middleware for Mercari's microservice kit, which helped other teams quickly migrate to v2 gRPC endpoints. I also implemented PoC in master-jp microservice. - Led the OKR to reduce engineering hours required to update client configs, which resulted in a significant reduction from ~4 hrs/week to zero. I achieved this by migrating configs from JSON-based store to Firebase. - Investigated and designed solutions to secure the master-tool used to update master data behind Mercari's VPN, improving the overall security of the tool. - Created and improved documentation for tasks and processes that I went through, helping other developers to work efficiently.  In this role, I worked with a range of technologies including Golang, PHP, gRPC, Kubernetes, GKE, Spanner, DataDog, and Spinnaker.
position_description_6: Managing a concise and concentrated team of 5+ members to create and maintain the technology infrastructure for IIT Technology Ambit, a startup aiming at serving research news in a digestable manner right from the premiere institutes of the country.  - Responsible for curating a pure RESTful API with database handling using Object Relational Mapping to MySQL. - Using ReactJS with other components to deliver consistent frontend experience across devices with the help of Progressive Web App development techniques. - Handling entire developer options including but not limited to server operations, bulk communication infrastructure, DNS management and more. - Responsible for hiring new technical talent from the campus and working closely with design and content team to ensure consistency across different departments. - Occasionally writing technical content and tutorials for the magazine.
position_description_7: Students' Technology Coordinator is a nominated position under the constitution of Technology Students' GymKhana, IIT Kharagpur. The person holding, the highest technical implementation and development position in the institute, is responsible for the smooth building and development of all technological growth aspects; official website maintenance, mobile app development, students' grievance portal and implementation of proposals of Vice President and General Secretaries of GymKhana.  I worked passionately during my tenure and implemented open source ethics and practices in document management, code sanitization, and CI/CD processes in order to streamline the development, testing, and deployment process. I also created a systematic organization that would allow the passing of knowledge and responsibilities between consecutive position holders very smooth. This is in addition to the numerous initiatives I took and various technical feats achieved for the Gymkhana digitization process.
position_description_8: Worked on Continuous Integration platform for CCExtractor's principal repository: - Improved the python code sanity checking mechanisms through mypy, dodgy and other tools.  - Using Python's mocking unit-tests increased unit-test coverage from 60.2\% to 90+\%.  - Responsible for setting up database migration methods and improving file diff algorithms.  - Implemented multiprocessing and parallelisation using Python's multiprocessing module and bypassing Global Interpreter lock for using multiple-cores. - Implemented automation scripts to update outdated regression test output and improved overall efficiency of regression test output delivery from taking 50+ seconds to 5 (+-1) seconds using delivery fragmentation.
position_description_9: Worked as a backend engineer for Cleartax's ITR filing tool closely working with financial experts.  - Updated stale data in micro-services and API data-layers fixing issues with the external REST API endpoints.  - Synchronized ITR-2, ITR-3 and ITR-4 filing with Income Tax Department's new schema for 2018 fiscal-year ITR filing while retaining backward compatibility with 2017 ITR filing. - Enabled ITR filing for Non Residential Indians by incorporating missing fields and adding relevant logical switches in ITR-2, ITR-3 and ITR-5. - Improved Developer-Operations and debugging capability by implementing logging of crucial parameters using IIS Manager, Scalyr, Spinnaker and Jenkins. - Developed captcha solver for Income Tax Department's login using convolutional neural network with TensorFlow, OpenCV and Keras achieving 94.3% accuracy. - Enabled A/B testing with Google Tag Manager and Google Optimize along with orchestrating multiple tools for easy data visualisation (for use by Business and Marketing department) with Retool.
position_description_10: Software as a Service (SaaS) platform founded and launched in June 2019 to ease the setting up and execution of cron-tasks; led the tech-team with stack comprising of Google Cloud Platform (AppEngine, CloudSQL, PubSub, CloudScheduler), Python, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes API and more.

headline: SDE-2 @ Zomato | Ex Zeotap, InterviewBit/Scaler | SIH-2022 Winner | AIR 364 Google Hashcode
summary: Passionate Software Engineer with expertise in backend development, distributed systems, and high-performance architecture. I specialize in scalability, microservices, event-driven architectures, and optimizing large-scale systems to deliver low-latency, high-throughput applications.  At Zomato, I engineered a cross-platform Single Sign-On (SSO), enhancing security while reducing unauthorized access by 80%. I built the express ordering model, cutting delivery time to under 30 minutes, and optimized a high-traffic historical API, slashing latency by 98% using Kafka-driven DynamoDB pre-calculation and Redis caching. Additionally, I replaced a high-resource cron job with an event-driven hybrid model, reducing execution time from 2-3 minutes to just 300ms.  Previously at Zeotap, I designed a high-efficiency polling service, reducing system load by 30%, and optimized microservices, cutting CPU & memory usage by 15%. At Scaler, I developed Admin Dashboard features, improving page load speed from 65% to 92%.  Tech Stack: C++, Go, JavaScript, Node.js, Kafka, RabbitMQ, Redis, DynamoDB, PostgreSQL, MySQL, AWS, Microservices, System Design, Event-Driven Architectures, Caching Strategies, Real-Time Data Processing.  Competitive Programming & Achievements: 950+ Leetcode problems solved, Top 5% worldwide (1876 Knight rating) 1818 (4-star) CodeChef, Global Rank 105 in DIV-2 Smart India Hackathon 2022 Winner Google Hashcode 2022: India Rank 364 / 12,000+ teams, Global Rank 1444 Scaler CodeX 2.0: All India Rank 810 / 28,000+ participants  Always eager to solve complex scalability challenges, improve system performance, and build highly available, distributed systems.

headline: Assistant Vice President
summary: With over 21 years of industry experience, I‚Äôve led and contributed to the development of a wide range of products and platforms across domains such as Core Logistics, Customer Experience, Ad Tech, and Travel & Location Services.  I bring deep hands-on expertise in Java/J2EE technologies, complemented by practical experience with modern tools and systems like Kafka, RabbitMQ, Redis, DynamoDB, Postgres, Thrift, and gRPC.  My strength lies in designing and building robust, scalable, multi-tiered distributed systems, with a strong emphasis on architecture, performance, and resilience. I‚Äôm passionate about cultivating an engineering culture rooted in excellence‚Äîfocusing on clean design, high code quality, automation, thorough documentation, actionable metrics, and operational readiness.  I have a proven track record of building and scaling high-performing engineering teams‚Äîfrom hiring and mentoring top talent to driving execution across multiple initiatives with a sharp eye on prioritization, delivery, and long-term impact.  Proven ability to build and lead high-performing engineering teams‚Äîincluding hiring, mentoring, and retaining top talent‚Äîand manage multiple projects simultaneously with a clear focus on prioritization and delivery.
position_description_1: I head engineering for the Driver, Delivery, and Post-Order Customer Experience orgs at Swiggy, leading a highly skilled team of 100+ developers and SDETs. We work at the intersection of scale, speed, and complexity‚Äîsolving tough problems across hyperlocal logistics, from order fulfillment, dynamic restaurant serviceability, and fleet efficiency to driver lifecycle management, payouts, and real-time delivery orchestration.  My responsibilities also span post-order experiences, including intelligent service recovery, conversational AI/chatbots, customer contact center platforms, and location intelligence systems‚Äîall aimed at ensuring seamless interactions across our three-way marketplace of customers, restaurants, and delivery partners.  Over the years, I‚Äôve had the privilege of contributing to Swiggy‚Äôs remarkable scale journey, witnessing a 40x growth in order volumes and a 100x increase in traffic. I‚Äôve led the creation of key platforms like the Location Platform and Workflow Platform, building critical infrastructure and capabilities from the ground up.  A highlight has been nurturing an engineering culture that champions open source and innovation‚Äîfrom encouraging contributions to Netflix Conductor, to developing and open-sourcing our own functional testing framework, Grill.  Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do‚ÄîI work closely with product, data science, analytics, business operations, and program management teams to build scalable, intelligent, and impactful solutions that power Swiggy‚Äôs last-mile logistics engine.
position_description_2: Leading the core logistics charter where my 40+ members teams are responsible for capacity allocation, driver assignment, batching, serviceability, promises and interfacing with 3PL logistics partners. These platforms are multi tenet in nature and cater to all business categories across Swiggy. These platforms drive the critical business customer, driver and cost per delivery metrics. These systems power and affect the entire journey of a customer‚Äôs order; from predicting SLAs for a given set of restaurants using AI models when the app is opened, to the time the order is delivered to the Customer‚Äôs doorstep. The team‚Äôs charter encompasses  sophisticated algorithms and ML models that assign orders within minutes, in order to deliver the order within a 30-45min time slot, while maximising utilisation and efficiency of the fleet, to monitoring the order and automating interventions to handle exceptional conditions.
position_description_3: Have donned several hats at Swiggy handling fulfilment, outbound call center operation, TnS, cancellation and location. Started my journey from breaking a legacy unstable monolithic into a set of highly scalable, resilient micro services architecture at the same time seeing a 15x growth.  Was responsible for building an asynchronous workflow platform at Swiggy, forking Netflix Conductor, that is hosting 100+ workflows across Swiggy business lines at scale. In the process the team made open source contributions to the Netflix Conductor software. Built the multi tenet Location Platform from scratch to solve some of the hyperlocal location problems across Swiggy business lines related to accurate payout, address onboarding, enrichment and corrections, tracking screen experience, batching etc. As part of the Location Platform charter I was responsible for building various platforms under Routing, Central Address Service and Address Enrichment Jobs using DS models, Regions Core platform to power geo functions, Geofencing & Rider Movement Data ingestion pipeline.
position_description_4: Managed the InMobi's Ad Serving Platform that generates the majority of Inmobi's revenue. This discovery platform is one of the world's leading ad serving platforms serving 4 billion ad requests a day and handling a billion unique users. Our products help advertisers to serve ads optimally, optimize relevance of ads to make the advertiser maximize his ROI, and monitor progress of different advertising campaigns, and doing all of this at real-time in milliseconds!    Prior to that I was handling the Customer Interface portal, bunch of Micro Services (10+) and various external facing APIs on which the InMobi Ad Network operates.  My responsibilities include  Working with product managers to understand the App Download business and help them in scaling it. Overall responsible for all the releases ensuring highest quality - error rate < 0.5% , performance - p95 latency of 200 ms. Ensuring best engineering practices like unit testing, code reviews, emitting right metrics, alerts, monitoring etc are followed as religion. Providing predictability and transparency to Engineering Leadership, Product, PMO and other stakeholders in execution and releases by following agile methodologies.   Collaborating across multiple teams in releases to ensure App Download business runs smoothly. Be a technical mentor & coach for reportees & play an active role in defining a career development path for them. Play an active role in defining the hiring plan & execution of the same.
position_description_5: Led a bunch of very smart engineers to develop InMobi's next generation Customer Interface as a single page web application. Implemented several best practices to improve the overall performance of the portal. Was primarily responsible to safeguard the portal against security vulnerabilities. Built various platform and business micro services using Apache Thrift which simplified and accelerated development of existing complex enterprise systems.  Was primarily responsible for end to end delivery of Native Advertising Platform. I was the first engineer to work on the POC of this product which help the business team in on boarding a major app developer to integrate Native Ads with us. Looking at the disrupting nature of this product it was developed from scratch in no time and was live within a month without any major bugs. Designed and developed RESTful APIs using Apache CXF which helped on board customers and content sharing outside InMobi.
position_description_6: Was leading the B2B product engineering team at Cleartrip.  Was working directly with product head to understand the B2B business and drive the engineering team.  Worked as an individual contributor in designing, developing and deploying various B2B products like Agency and Corporate. Was also part of the team that developed the Whitelable framework to help integrate other major travel portals like Expedia with Cleartrip.

headline: Product Leader
summary: With over a decade of experience in the consumer internet space, I‚Äôve worked across startups and scaled enterprises- building, optimizing, and transforming digital ecosystems that drive performance and growth.   Currently, I lead Martech at Swiggy, where I‚Äôve reimagined the marketing tech stack to unlock data-driven marketing at scale. My work blends AI/ML, behavioral data, and product thinking to create solutions that enable high-ROAS performance campaigns, hyper-personalized experiences, and smarter marketing attribution.  At the heart of what I do is a deep focus on impact through systems- building tools that aren‚Äôt just clever, but meaningfully shift business outcomes. From conversion propensity models to user-product embeddings to full-stack Martech rebuilds, I work at the intersection of growth, product, and data science.  Before Swiggy, I was an entrepreneur in the B2B SaaS space, building high-retention products for SMBs-where I learned the art of scrappy execution, product-market fit, and building for real-world stickiness.  I hold a PGDM from the Goa Institute of Management, where I cultivated both my strategic thinking and my bias for execution.  I‚Äôm passionate about solving complex problems using deep tech and systems thinking- especially in domains like Martech, marketplaces, and performance-led product design. I thrive in environments that value curiosity, velocity, and outcomes over optics.  If you‚Äôre working on something at the intersection of growth, tech, and product- let‚Äôs connect.
position_description_1: Leading Martech at Swiggy, where I‚Äôve rearchitected the marketing stack to enable data-driven growth at scale. My focus is on building products that combine deep tech with practical impact- whether it‚Äôs AI/ML-driven tools for ROAS optimization, dynamic audience systems, or hyper-personalized engagement engines. headline: Ad-Tech HR || Talent Partner || Talent Acquisition || Quality Talent Solutions Provider || Working Mom
summary: Thanks for stopping by!  I believe that progress is everyone's business. I'm a Solutions-focused, meticulous and result-oriented professional with 10+ Years of experience into Human Resources with a demonstrated history of working in the Advertisement and Staffing Industry.  Skilled in Adtech Hirings, Negotiation, People Management, Payroll & Employee Engagement Activities. I Feel lucky for having a successful career with diverse roles distinguished by commended performance and proven results.  At Talent Hunt, strategic talent acquisition and people culture from hire to retire are the pillars of my role. My expertise lies in building teams with world-class talent, closely collaborating with business leaders to understand and execute hiring strategies that align with overarching business goals. Crafting a positive work environment and fostering strong employee relations have been central to my tenure.  My tenure at BlendAi Digital honed my skills in developing HR strategies that resonate with organizational objectives, ensuring a seamless integration of talent management and employee engagement activities. Partnering with stakeholders and managing vendor relationships, I've successfully implemented policies that contribute to a healthy workplace culture, driving performance and retention of top talent.  Inquisitive? You're welcome to explore my world.

summary: I am often referred to as a "people person" by my friends and colleagues,  which is why perhaps I love being a product manager, as interacting and collaborating with users and cross-functional teams is at the heart of a PM‚Äôs job responsibilities. position_description_3: - Townscript got rebranded as Townhall - Built and executed 40+ professional conferences with 10K+ attendees in 7 months on Townscript‚Äôs virtual conferencing platform Townhall.co. - Managed cross-functional teams, stakeholder communication, and oversaw end-to-end development for Townhall's B2C Venue app, B2C Virtual Broadcasting studio, and B2B DIY organizer admin console. - Townhall Venue App: Defined an attendee-facing virtual conference app to accommodate professional multi-track, multi-day conferences with parallel sessions, virtual booths, networking lounge etc. where the streaming can happen via RTMP technology from any studio. - Townhall Broadcasting Studio: Ideated and built a fully integrated in-house browser-based virtual broadcasting studio eliminating the need to use third-party studios. - DIY Organizer Admin Console: Built a DIY dashboard for organizers to manage all of the content from one place which resulted in faster conference creation and eliminated manual intervention of Townscript support team. - Worked with no-code Bubble developers to define MVP and test it with early users for initial validations. - Actively conducted usability studies and feedback sessions with 50+ users and internal user-facing teams. Identified their pain points and used their feedback to make product iterations, improve UX and define roadmap, and backlog.
position_description_4: - Ideated, built, and shipped Townscript's webinar product Townscript Live that saw over 500 events with over 25k+ attendees.. Researched users, competition and collaborated with sales and marketing teams to define and own its feature set and roadmap. - Analysed data to track user activity and feedback in virtual events and used it to maintain a 4.7 average rating of the platform. - Analyzed and discovered drop-off in Townscript's KYC completion funnel and improved KYC conversions from 40% to 90% and eliminated all customer support queries by revamping the KYC wayfinding and filling process. - Performed Guerrilla testing for Townscript‚Äôs revamped event ticket booking process and identified UX changes that resulted in 30% faster checkouts. - Worked alongside a professional user research company to conduct various types of user studies namely Persona study, Diary study, Usability studies, Prototype testing, Guerilla testing, and user interviews. - Singlehandedly designed an automated invoicing system to track all customer invoices at once and eliminate manual calculations. - Communicated, negotiated, and partnered with a financial operations vendor for reconciliations from multiple PGs resulting in a fault-free and faster process, reducing the time the finance team spent on reconciliation by 50%.

Worked on restful APIs and services like Volley. - Worked on remote debugging for issues occurring in on-site android devices with a deeper understanding of ADB logs, dump, etc - Delivered software solutions consistent with release plan milestones.

headline: Co-Founder & CTO, Robylon AI, AI powered Customer Support - Improve resolution times by 90% and reduce costs by 30%
summary: üëã Currently, I am building Robylon.ai. We help companies automate customer support using AI. We support all 4 channels - Tickets, Chats, Social, and Voice. Our solutions helps companies: 1. Automate >80% of customer queries 2. Improve Resolution times by >90% 3. Reduce costs by >30%  Before Robylon.ai, I co-founded OneWorldNation (OWN) - a gaming platform built on top of blockchain. We launched 7 games and reached $2 million in annual revenue within 18 months. However, due to unfavorable tax law changes in India, we had to pivot away from it.  During my time at Uber, I led initiatives aimed at improving the agent experience and unifying Postmates‚Äô support with Uber‚Äôs, resulting in approximately $60 million in annual savings for the company. This role helped refine my abilities in tech leadership, team building, crisis management, and collaboration.  I love discussions around automation, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and Football.
position_description_1: At Robylon, we help companies automate customer support using AI. We support all 4 channels - Tickets/Emails, Chats, Social and Voice. Our solution helps companies:  1. Automate over 80% of customer queries 2. Improve resolution times by over 90% 3. Reduce costs by over 30%  We are so confident in our solution, we only charge per resolved query.
position_description_2: At OneWorldNation (OWN), we built a gaming ecosystem on top of a blockchain. We focused on creating a mobile-first gaming ecosystem, offering both traditional and modern casino games.   As the CTO, I oversaw the tech vertical of the company. My responsibilities included building NFT marketplaces and custom ERC-20 currencies for the platform, as well as establishing support for real-time transactions over blockchain and fiat currencies across the platform."  Within just 18 months, we scaled our platform to generate $2 million in annual revenue, attracting 50k paying monthly users and 250k paying users overall. Additionally, we secured $2 million in seed funding from VCs, enabling us to expand our team and develop 7 games that gained traction across 8 countries (India, Philippines, Brazil).  We decided to pivot after August 2023 because the new GST laws introduced by the Government of India made it no longer viable to run the venture profitably.
position_description_3: In my role at Uber, I led initiatives aiming at enhancing Agent experience through projects including: - Expanding Uber's support conversations to handle multi-party interactions, addressing high-touch issues like Uber Safety support and Uber Freight. - Integrating Postmates in the stack, saving $60M in agent costs. - Implementing real-time translation features in Uber Support Platform, resulting in $6M annual savings for Japanese support tickets, with potential $40M savings across all languages.  Additionally, I contributed to mitigating Uber-wide outages as a member of Uber's Ring0 rotation and co-owned the backend on-call rotation for Customer Obsession, organizing handoffs across the organization.
position_description_4: In my role, I was a core member of the team responsible for building a data stack for real-time use and event analytics. Additionally, I developed systems to generate product personalizations in campaigns and implemented tools to visualize application metrics.  Through my work, I honed skills in data migration, analytics stack development, and personalized recommendation systems. I also gained experience in implementing caching mechanisms and visualization tools to enhance application monitoring.  My experience across a range of technologies greatly enhanced my comfort with tech and system architecture. This was recognized with an award for outstanding performance.
position_description_5: In my first tech role at Cubeit, I worked on the following tasks: - Developed data crawling jobs to get data from various services like Yelp, Zomato, DailyMotion, and news sources, then organized and stored it in Elasticsearch. - Implemented an Android search interface to answer queries based on the collected data.
position_description_6: Under the guidance of Professor Nitesh V. Chawla, I worked with Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique (SMOTE) for synthetic data generation using Neural Networks.   Collaborating with Professor Chawla's team expanded my knowledge of Machine Learning and sparked my interest in solving real-world problems using AI.

headline: Co-Founder at Mopid
summary: 9 years of hustling has led me to understand First principles from the fundamentals.  I firmly believe that you can always go one step beyond in understanding the problem.  Skilling is a problem that goes way beyond learning. Our survival depends on how well the human race can learn and adapt. In a world where time comes with a premium, static learning is a huge backlog for the human race, with a lot of time getting wasted.  Examarly, as a product is built around the philosophy that -  Learning, if personalised, can save a lot of time.   Being a self-learner all my life, I have a stronghold on the concepts of the problem and the market.  At Examarly, we are building a decentralised ecosystem of learning, where content is sourced from the community itself and provides upward mobility to learners.  Hence, content & knowledge become decentralised, within the community.  Education comes full circle.  At Examarly, we are making this come true. Utopia is to upskill and make learning possible even at the remotest corners of the world for free.
position_description_1: Ai agentic workflow automation for recruitment.
position_description_2: An initiative where we are building a community of entrepreneurs who are in the start of their journey to help connect them with the right resources, people and mentorship.
position_description_3: I joined Examarly in January 2020 as the Product Officer having experience in building solutions previously.  My Journey has enabled me to understand businesses from the very core and helped me evolve as a Product & Growth person.  At Examarly i'm leading Product, Marketing & Growth and we aim to curate the internet into a personalised learning path for our users to help them learn at a faster pace.  So far we have achieved upto 60% personalisation and upto 30% faster learning.   Our vision is to decentralise education and make learning possible even at the remotest corners of the world.
position_description_4: Was invited by Josh Talks to talk about my journey and what led me to build Examarly.
position_description_5: After Q&H i started my Retail trading journey, i used to trade in Indian equities, commodities, forex.  Had also joined a trading floor ( Bearstreet ) where i traded in American equities and FTSE.  Alongside this i worked as a Freelance Equity & Business Analyst for HNI's.
position_description_6: Soon after Sunfib Capital we were Aquihired by a Hong Kong Based Cryptocurrency Startup Q&H Capital, Our place of work was New Delhi and we were serving Indian HNI's helping them invest in the cryptocurrency market.  In 2 months we had hit 1cr AUM but soon RBI came up with guidelines declaring cryptocurrencies as illegal tenders which led us to close the company.  Sunfib Capital was restarted after this but my interest had waned by this time and i wanted to explore retail trading &  american equities so didn't join it again.  Learning : Regulations can kill businesses
position_description_7: My Mentor at Share India had started off this venture where we delivered research and education on the capital markets. I joined him after my stint with Share India to help build the company.
position_description_8: My love for businesses made me explore the financial markets.  So after about 2 months of study i joined Share India as an Arbitrager, this was a great experience as it helped me look right inside the brokerage industry and how brokers & the capital markets function.
position_description_9: Joined College for 6 Months after Ni8, College was really boring so dropped out within 6 months to pursue e-commerce with amazon which seemed like a great opportunity.  This led to the setting up of RHO Enterprises (Loved Physics ;) always wanted to keep afloat.  Mobiles was the product of choice (Which was a very bad decision considering the players & capital involved) Stayed afloat for sometime as i also started selling locally branded electronics in my home town and via ebay.  Also tried to launch a clothing brand (fast fashion based ) which never took off as demonetisation happened and there was a significant shock to the supply chain.  To make a place for myself in the marketplace i had to have good seller ratings which was not possible to achieve quickly with mobile phones as i was operating on limited quantity. For this what i did was picked up the best selling book in India (HC Verma, Physics again ;) and sold it at half the price, and included a rate us flyer inside every book, with led to very good seller ratings on the marketplace which in turn led to a 5x growth in my product sales.  The operations involved were really complex and as i couldn't maintain inventory, communication with my customers & product delivery was taking alot of time Amazon blocked me.
position_description_10: A brief stint with Food Delivery before college started.  Me & Friends got together to solve the problem of availability of food at night in my home town Prayagraj.  Ran it for around 6 months, niched down on a single college that we started serving, made the packaging really creative so that we can generate Word of mouth.  Made a good amount of money and served many customers. We had never thought about running it at scale so initially closed it down.  Learnings : Customer Experience helps generate WOM The brand name is very important, as their was no association with the name we chose and what we did.

headline: Director of Engineering  - Swiggy | Ex- HolidayIQ, OLA
summary: üöÄ Director of Engineering | Platform & Product Leader | Scaled Systems | Zero-to-One Builder  I‚Äôm a tech leader with 14+ years of experience building and scaling high-impact consumer platforms, leading cross-functional orgs, and delivering measurable business outcomes across hypergrowth environments.  At Swiggy, I lead engineering for the Dineout and Scenes verticals‚Äîbusinesses contributing over ‚Çπ300 Cr in monthly GMV with 20%+ YoY growth. I built and launched the Scenes event ticketing platform from scratch in under 6 weeks, and led the post-acquisition tech integration of Dineout, simplifying systems, consolidating teams, and boosting delivery velocity by 40%.  Previously, I spearheaded Swiggy‚Äôs growth tech charter‚Äîowning user acquisition, onboarding funnels, and Martech infrastructure at scale. I‚Äôve built multi-tenant checkout systems, real-time APIs, and personalization engines, and drove Swiggy‚Äôs accessibility program that now impacts millions of users.  From zero-to-one product delivery to platform convergence and team scaling, I thrive at the intersection of tech, product, and org design. I‚Äôm passionate about building lean, high-ownership teams, driving cross-functional alignment, and using engineering as a force multiplier for business.
position_description_1: Lead engineering for Swiggy‚Äôs Dineout and Scenes verticals, generating ‚Çπ300 Cr+ monthly GMV with 43%+ YoY growth; built and launched the zero-to-one Scenes platform in under 6 weeks. Shaped product and tech vision in close partnership with business; drove quarterly OKRs and long-term roadmap for vertical expansion. Directed end-to-end tech integration for the Dineout acquisition, driving org consolidation, system convergence, and platform unification across Swiggy‚Äôs core architecture. Led simplification efforts that boosted execution velocity by 40% and cut latency by over 50%. Manage a 50+ member org across discovery, transactions, supply, and platform teams, with 1 SEM, 2 EMs, and 1 architect; report directly to the CTO. Responsible for org design, succession planning, and growing a strong second line of leaders through mentoring and structured talent development.
position_description_2: Led Swiggy‚Äôs ‚ÄúTraffic and Acquisition‚Äù charter, owning new user acquisition, dormant user reactivation, and martech systems across web and app; delivered scalable growth features impacting millions. Managed 3 engineering teams (MarTech, consumer web, checkout) with 20+ engineers; launched initiatives like contextual onboarding, streamlined checkout, and discounting levers like free delivery. Defined and scaled Swiggy‚Äôs MarTech platform‚Äîenabling digital ad targeting, campaign automation, and owned media personalization; first in Asia to integrate Facebook DPA for geo-targeted food ads. Drove accessibility for Swiggy‚Äôs apps and web platforms, building inclusive experiences for blind and motor-impaired users; invited as jury at Prosus SICA 2022 for contributions to inclusive tech, Blog post

Developed a web-based multi-tenant checkout system supporting multiple business lines (Food, Instamart, Genie) across web, hybrid, and native apps‚Äîresulting in improved cart-to-payment conversion and payment success rates. Built a high-reliability WebView infrastructure with support for native contracts, versioning, monitoring, and graceful fallbacks; enabled rapid client-tech rollout for Instamart, Stores, and Genie. Drove end-to-end execution of several high-impact initiatives in close collaboration with product and business, aligning user experience, performance, and maintainability across platforms.
position_description_4: Led a 16-member engineering team, owning hiring, execution, and performance across backend and web; represented engineering in monthly CXO forums and reported to the CTO. Architected high-scale platforms including access control, API gateways, real-time clickstream processing, and a generic video generation engine using Node.js, Kafka, and MySQL. Drove major tech transformations including microservices adoption, Docker, ELK, and PWA (React); mentored ML interns on photo classification, sentiment analysis, and FAQ systems. Partnered with PMs and data science teams to prototype ML-driven features, laying the foundation for personalization and automation capabilities.

headline: Data Scientist II @ Swiggy | ML Engineer at heart
summary: I once thought AI was just a bunch of if else statements, until I realized I was peeking at an ocean through a pinhole.  Opening that view took me from curiosity to 3+ years at Swiggy, building ML systems for recommendations, personalization, geocoding, and LLM applications. summary: currently  I'm  working in building chatbot solutions for seller support in e-commerce using GenAI. I had experience previously working in Recommendations NLP domain. position_description_4: During my 6+ years at Flipkart, I had the opportunity to work on several cutting-edge machine learning projects that significantly impacted both customer experience and business outcomes.  One of my key projects was designing and implementing the Seller Intelligent Assistant (SIA), an NLP-powered chatbot for Flipkart sellers. This involved creating a sophisticated architecture with components like a Contextual Query Generator, hierarchical intent classification, and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), using Transformer-based models and GPT-3.5 turbo.  I also led the development of a Journey Gamification system, introducing a level-based structure to enhance user retention. By deploying a neural network-based personalized high-value action recommendation model, we saw a 0.12% improvement in C/UV and a 2.2% increase in monthly retention during online A/B testing.  In the fashion category, I developed a size and fit recommendation system using customer feedback and product features, resulting in improved F1 scores and a 33bps reduction in return rates. Additionally, I created an auto-answering system for user queries, implemented across the Mobiles vertical, improving both engagement and conversions.  Other highlights include building a non-personalized review ranking system, leading to an 11bps improvement in net conversion, and personalizing the Super Coin Zone through an FTRL-based online learning model, which boosted CTR and reduced bounce rates.  I am now excited to bring these experiences to my new role at Flash.co, where I‚Äôll be leading all machine learning projects.

headline: Co-founder & CEO at UrbanVault
summary: Amal Mishra is the Founder and CEO of UrbanVault, a game-changing provider of managed office spaces reshaping the commercial real estate landscape with more than 25000 seats in Bangalore. His story reflects the power of bootstrapping backed by the commitment to provide exceptional services to clients. He holds an undergrad degree in Computer Science from IIIT Hyderabad. Prior to UrbanVault, he co-founded Livospire, where he gained invaluable experience in the real estate and furniture industry. The hands-on involvement equipped him with a unique blend of expertise that contributes to the innovative solutions at both UrbanVault and Livospire. In addition, he has served as a Product Manager at Cisco for nearly four years, further honing his skills and knowledge in the technology sector. This experience enables him to bring a strategic perspective and a deep understanding of market trends to UrbanVault. By combining his background in real estate, furniture, and technology, he brings a comprehensive skill set that drives his ability to deliver cutting-edge solutions to the clients.  Join him and the UrbanVault team in redefining commercial real estate, driving innovation, and shaping the future of work. #UrbanVault #CommercialRealEstate #Workspaces #Innovation
position_description_2: Livospire has been set up with a vision to organize the locally produced and consumed budget furniture market. Incidentally, Video Surveys was trending soon after its launch at ProductHunt.

I had wanted to leave my personal mark at the company and create a product that will encourage me to think outside the box. Enterprise Service Catalog was the perfect opportunity to challenge myself. It enables users to make ESC the epi-center of their data collection endeavors and create a singular portal link with a unified URL. The idea took root from the need to categorize multiple surveys efficiently and I am delighted to have executed it successfully with the Enterprise Service Catalog.
position_description_6: Built the super-powered voice-assisted survey, from scratch. The speech synthesis and speech recognition ability made the experience just virtual-assistant like. The survey reads out the questions/options to you, understands your response, and takes actions accordingly (selecting an option/Skip Question/Previous question, etc).  But, what made it different from other Audio Surveys in the market? It‚Äôs not just embedding an audio/video into the survey; the voice-driven surveys completely assists the survey-taker throughout by giving him voice assistance and responding to the voice commands. Move over, Siri! :)

headline: Software Architect at CRED | Ex-Flipkart
summary: I am a Computer Science enthusiast, with Masters degree from DA-IICT Campus.  Passionate to solve challenging problems with technology - design and building architecture of the systems for such problem. Always keen to keep myself up to date with the latest tech innovations happening around the globe. I've had more than 4 years of experience achieving the same, and growing myself rapidly along in the journey.
position_description_1: Enjoying building core banking and lending ecosystem!
position_description_3: Retail as a Service: ‚ÄãWorking across several scrums of retail and building a B2B Suite, a multi-tenant distributed microservices. Primarily pivoting around domain-driven-design and plug-and-play architecture. Observing common patterns and keeping lightweight business layers, and using common tech components. FK B2B buy-side, FK wholesale, Myntra, etc are the prime users, to begin with Kubernetes for Seller&Supply Ecosystem Org: ‚ÄãDoing POC, finding out the goodness Kubernetes & docker brings, explaining to teams what it brings to the table, conducting the learning series sessions, and then leading the migration for the retail team containing 80+ micro services
position_description_4: - [From Scratch] As part of Accounting team, built a generic config management system for the common platform called MAAS. We had built ui with java based backend to enable CRUD of versioned config, restore config version with MongoDB store - [From Scratch] Worked on designing, execution management catalog quality platform; enabling guideline/questionnaire based manual/ML based quality checks of catalog data. Tech stacks involved dropwizard, redis based queues, mysql storage - [ReArch] Problem solved, rearchitected the oldest 7 year old catalog MDM system with 4 leads team; from monolith to SOA with proper SOC - different services involved different tech stacks such as dropwizard/poseidon frameworks; OpenAPI3.0 for contracts, mysql, hbase, ES, mongodb as stores - [Design POC] Experimented with product catalog as graph using "knowledge graph" phenomena. Modelled few thousands of products as graph, did POC on feasibility check with impact evaluation - Involved in several design supervisions/reviews for value recovery team handling reverse inventory at Flipkart. Few examples are: automated simulation for rule engine platform, seller demand based automated inventory allocation with order, low TAT grocery liquidation, context preservation platform etc - [From Scratch] Working on inventory view platform, that subscribes to millions of inventory mutation stream & has ability to create configurable custom client views -  using different computation logics such as FIFO/LIFO/Entity references based etc. The views power different use cases such as liquidation, inventory ageing, lineage for vendor returns/NLC, inventory health reporting, claims computations, P & L reports etc. Primary streaming stack being spark; H2 cache with HBase, ES as stores & quartz, azkaban schedulers. Took care of requirement gathering, design+architect the system with architects/principal architects, task breakup/allocation, regular execution checkpointing with developers, stakeholder management E2E
position_description_5: [Part of Team] Worked on inventory accounting for retail; to gather inventory valuation, QoH, COGS calculations, stock ledger etc. 1. Processing lakhs of events, being taken care by a full fledged system using Kafka as buffer, SwiftMq for async messaging, and java/ruby based backend systems, MySQL as datastore. 2. Developed map-reduce based reports to have better visibility on this data 3. Writing highly optimized code to process events in milliseconds.   [From Scratch with team] As part of accounting, a common Accounting Service Layer Platform(MAAS) has been built, that handles common accounting constructs such as invoicing, payments, accruals etc in a generic way. I was involved in core team of ASL platform; to problem solve generically and work config driven than code driven; design, architect and implement this system end to end from scratch.  System is divided into seven core components, with few more planned just after these are live: 1. Idempotency: Makes sure event is processed only once in the system for a business unit.  2. Validator: The system uses groovy to have dynamicity of validation rules. It is completely config driven and requires no code change to add/update/remove any validations. 3. Augmenter: In-house built DSL to ease the implementation of business processing for accounting events. 4. Enricher: The system uses augmenter and enriches core event with enough data, to make accounting entries. 5. Rating: a full fledged system that understands several rate masters and calculates amounts based on defined rules. 6. Recording: System that make use of enriched data and creates several accounting entries as per the configuration defined. 7. Error Handling: A very generically built system; consisting of UI to have better visibility, java library with AOP based implementation for easy integration with very few lines and a backend system that maintains errors, along with no. of retries, owner of the error, impact being caused by the error etc.
position_description_6: Worked as a developer in a 3 members team for developing an accounting payables system for Retail Accounting at Flipkart. The system handled all complex flows of purchase flows of retail commerce, such as billing, debit notes(damaged/lesser inventory than billed), credit notes(reversal of debit notes), advance payments etc.  1. Developed backend using Ruby on Padrino with ActiveRecord. Backend DB uses MySQL as a transactional data store. 2. Developed UI console using Ruby on Rails involving a lot of jQuery/javascript and CSS. The console is built to ease work of finance operations at Flipkart. 3. Hands on lot of popular/custom in-house built gems being used across different ruby platforms.
position_description_7: Worked on open source OpenTaps based erp system to maintain accounting payables module.  As part of internship, I've worked on a large org wide project named proc2pay - which changes processes from procurement requirements to payment of vendor. I was involved in leading the effort from accounting side, along with my mentor's guidance, in the project.  The project is intended for:   > Better visibility on open(unprocured but ordered) quantities    > Easier process to maintain bad/quality check rejected inventory   > Easier supplier returns   > Simplified supplier payments and supplier return policies
position_description_8: AlmaConnect is a company focusing on alumni social networking.  As part of the internship, I worked on ruby on rails based project to enable the view of friend's activities and their connections.
position_description_9: Worked in a team of 2 interns.  We built a web-site, that is intended for online bidding. The major features included registering customer/seller with free/paid packages, Bid for the products, Payment Gateway(PayPal) integration, Communication/notification via mailing facility.
