headline: Polyglot Engineer / WhatsApp Business / AI Agents
summary: Working as a versatile Technopreneur, including roles as an Independent Contractor, Senior Software Engineer, Product Manager, Solutions Architect, Tech Content Creator, Corporate Trainer, and Hands-on Instructor, I'm passionate about solving upcoming problems , helping people and creating a positive impact.  ‚ñ∫Software Development‚óÑ I lead a team of (10+ Developers) , we have built Blockchain and Fullstack Products (IOS, Android, Web) from POC to MVP to Production for 15+ Multinational Clients & Startups like Draftsy , Duggup , Astrofeast , Beam Suntory, Korn Ferry, Hitachi Energy, Allianz , TCL etc.  ‚ñ∫Experience‚óÑ 8+ years Technical Experience as Blockchain Engineer, Web3 & Backend Engineer , SRE, DevOps, Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) and MLOps Engineer for Rfox , Router Protocol, Reliance Jio, Oracle, Hitachi, UN.  ‚ñ∫Technical Corporate Trainings‚óÑ  I have delivered niche technology trainings to 50+ Diverse Industry Leaders, such as Deloitte, Dell, Vodafone, Infosys BPM, TCS, PepsiCo, Walmart, Redington, Allstate, Mercedes, Comcast, Bank of America, HiMedia, RBI, NPCI, BEL, CGI, Cognizant, Redbus, L&T, Fidelity , Apollo Hospitals, Mashreq Bank, Kale Logistics, Hexaware, Xoriant, Times Internet, HCL, Microgenesis, IOC etc.  ‚ñ∫Content Creation‚óÑ  Worked as a Tech Content Presenter  for Mugafi, Liminal Wallet , Programmer Writer for AMD, Aegon Life , Content Strategist for UpGrad & Emeritus, creating technical videos and preparing content and illustrations for Higher Education Learning (Blockchain, ML, DevOps, SRE).  ‚ñ∫Finishing School Instructor‚óÑ  Taught at IIM's (Knime , SQL, Advanced Excel) , IIT‚Äôs and MICA . Coding Instructor at Tech finishing schools and Bootcamps.  ‚ñ∫Education‚óÑ  I hold a Bachelors Degree in  Computer Science & Engineering from Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda (100 % Scholarship for being in Merit by Gujarat State Govt.) followed by PG Diploma in Applied Statistics from IGNOU.   Able to do justice to multiple roles due to participation in extracurricular activities since school days.  Was exposed to programming from grade 3, as dad is a programming and Excel instructor, prepared for exams like IIT-JEE, GATE, NDA SSB, GSOC, competed in hackathons, did six internships ranging from a software developer intern at KiVi Health (now Jio Health) to chief event organizer at ACM IIT-Delhi. Have published research papers in IEEE with college professors, served as a teaching assistant for algorithms, worked as a sales intern for MyScool Server Linux for education, written content for crash courses, conducted coding boot-camps, served as a QuizMaster.
position_description_1: I have led the development and growth of an AI-powered CRM platform designed to simplify customer engagement, automate workflows, and drive revenue across diverse sectors including events, education, healthcare, retail, and influencer marketing.  Key achievements and responsibilities include:  Product & Team Leadership:¬†Directed cross-functional teams of developers, designers, SEO specialists, sales, social media, and video editors to build and launch core features such as a universal inbox, lead generation bots, personalized drip campaigns, appointment booking, loyalty programs, and payment integrations‚Äîall unified on WhatsApp and social channels.  Customer Success & Pilots:¬†Delivered 50+ successful pilots with clients ranging from large-scale events (Weekend Bazaar, Waves Club) to influencers (Train with Shubham), healthcare providers, D2C brands, and community organizations. These pilots generated significant GMV, improved customer retention, and streamlined operations.  Branding, PR & Marketing:¬†Crafted and executed comprehensive branding, influencer collaborations, media outreach, and paid advertising strategies. Developed a MediaScaler plan for multi-channel campaigns across WhatsApp, SMS, email, and social platforms, resulting in increased lead generation and brand visibility.  Growth & Analytics:¬†Led cold outreach, lead qualification, and conversion optimization initiatives using data-driven A/B testing and real-time analytics dashboards. Enabled clients to track campaign performance, customer behavior, and ROI within the platform.  Operations & Scaling:¬†Managed hiring, team engagement, accounting, and DevOps to ensure smooth business operations and platform reliability. Implemented scalable automation workflows and integrations with POS and CRM systems to support rapid client onboarding.  Building a modular platform that empowers event organizers, educators, service pros, D2C brands, and influencers to automate marketing, sales, and support effortlessly.
position_description_2: At Krosspost.ai, we are building the ultimate content automation and distribution platform, designed for businesses, creators, and agencies in high-growth markets. Unlike traditional social media schedulers, Krosspost.ai goes beyond scheduling‚Äîwe detect, optimize, and automate content across platforms.  What We Offer:  Content Detection & Auto-Sharing: Seamlessly track and share content from YouTube, Medium, Substack, Ghost, Twitter (X), LinkedIn, Google My Business, Spotify, Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts, and even feedback forms.  Bulk Sending & Unique Addressing: Personalize messaging and scale communication efficiently.  Smart Scheduling: Drag-and-drop calendar for scheduling and rescheduling with ease.  AI-Powered Caption & Content Generation: Auto-generate captions and content tailored to each platform.  Advanced Analytics: Track post engagement and platform performance.  WhatsApp Agent : AI-driven WhatsApp assistant for posting, engagement, and summaries.  Approval Workflow & Team Collaboration: Built-in workflows for organizations and content teams.  Instant Alerts & EOD Reports: Receive updates on platform activity, engagement, and wallet status.  Meta Ads Posting & Humanized Engagement: AI-driven ad posting and engagement with a human touch.  As the founder, I oversee:  Product Development & UX: Managing developers, designers, and product teams.  Growth & Marketing: Driving SEO, social media, video content, and market research.  Operations & Finance: Handling customer support, QA, A/B testing, copywriting, branding, accounting, and legal aspects like trademarks.  Team Building & Outreach: Hiring contractors, managing CXO/CTO/COO-level operations, cold outreach, and strategic partnerships.  Analytics & Strategy: Data-driven decision-making to refine features and improve user experience.  Krosspost.ai is built to be the accessible alternative to Hootsuite, Sprout Social, and similar platforms‚Äîbridging the gap for businesses in emerging markets.
organization_title_3: Web3 Crypto SRE & Content Strategy Consultant
position_description_3: 1) STBL.com (Pi Protocol): I lead a five-member cross-functional team combining technical and content roles to advance STBL‚Äôs next-gen stablecoin ecosystem. On the tech front, we manage bridge deployments, multi-chain operations, and infrastructure using AWS ECS for container orchestration and AWS Amplify for frontend delivery. We enforce DevOps best practices via Retool (internal tools), Sentry (error monitoring), Posthog/Seline (user analytics), and wallet tracking for transparency. Our systems span Ethereum and Solana, ensuring scalability, security, and rapid incident response. Content-wise, we craft infographics, maintain technical documentation (Docusaurus), and produce video tutorials explaining key features like minting USST, handling YLD, and engaging in STBL governance. We collaborate with KOLs to maintain consistent messaging and drive community engagement. Analytics and automation fuel continuous UX and system reliability improvements. Our integrated approach supports institutional-grade infrastructure and educational content, positioning STBL for Stablecoin 2.0 and decentralized, yield-driven finance.  2) Zeru Finance: As a DevOps/SRE consultant, I designed a resilient microservices infrastructure using Kafka, AI services on ECS, and Jenkins-based CI/CD pipelines. I ensured high availability with robust monitoring, alerts, disaster recovery, cloud optimization, and strict security practices. I integrated observability tools and led the adoption of EigenLayer‚Äôs AVS, enabling verifiable reliability and transparent incident response for Zeru‚Äôs DeFi lending and onchain credit protocol.  3) Supersol Team: I managed validator node setup, DevOps automation, and infrastructure tuning for this high-performance, EVM-compatible blockchain, akin to Sonic SVM on Solana. I also authored detailed technical documentation and whitepapers to streamline developer onboarding and support architectural and deployment workflows.  4) OrangeWEB3: Smart Contract Audits and SRE.
position_description_4: 1) Catalyst Quizzing System: As the lead architect, I drove the design and implementation of a state-of-the-art leadership quizzing system for Catalyst, managing teams in QA, Frontend, Backend, DevOps, and UX. Our platform transformed pre- and post-training evaluations for leaders at Tata Sky and Samsung, and was adopted by other trainers. Featuring concurrency-based quizzing, seamless admin/trainer onboarding, unique code generation, group assignments, detailed reports, and feedback management, we empowered balanced decision-making and personalized leadership training.  2) Libra Valuers Real Estate Valuation company: The project automates data entry for 90%+ of banking portals using a custom browser extension and internal APIs. It fills all types of fields-including uploading multiple photos, videos, and navigating tabs-while extracting data from forms via OCR, performing calculations (like area), and inputting all details vital for real estate valuations.   3) Trade57 Exim : I led the design and delivery of a unified web, Android, and iPhone platform for global agri-trade. Core pillars included AI-powered analytics for food security, a B2B/B2G/G2G marketplace, embedded fintech (digital banking, crypto, trade assurance), and intelligent logistics. Key features delivered were real-time market data, predictive analytics, contract farming, by-product trading, and compliance. I managed sprint execution, enhancing product schemas, certificate flows, packaging, and master data, ensuring a scalable, robust solution.The marketplace allows even lesser-known or less-educated farmers to easily start exports, access real-time data, and connect with buyers worldwide.  4) UBIK AI : Built and delivered a privacy-first macOS assistant enabling offline, multi-platform workflow automation via natural language, deep system integration, and on-device AI, boosting productivity for knowledge workers, founders and executives.
position_description_5: 1. GPT2DOCX.com : GPT2DOCX effortlessly converts Markdown or AI-generated content into professional DOCX files. Ideal for content creators and developers, it streamlines document formatting and integrates with Google Docs for real-time collaboration and easy content management.  2. KrossPost.ai : KrossPost.ai automates content distribution across multiple social platforms with AI-powered optimization. Tailoring posts for each platform, it saves time for marketers and influencers while boosting engagement through personalized formatting and scheduling.  3. EaseData.ai :EaseData enables natural language queries across multiple Excel sheets, simplifying data analysis and reporting. Ideal for business users and analysts, it turns complex datasets into actionable insights without the need for technical expertise or manual data filtering.
organization_title_6: Solutions Architect : Ethereum / DeFi / NFT / Metaverse / Fullstack Developer / Product Manager
position_description_6: 1) Draftsy.com : As Product Manager & Solutions Architect for Draftsy, I led the development of a scalable fantasy sports platform, optimized features, managed UX, Backend, Mobile, SRE,QA  teams, and drove marketing efforts to engage users.  2) Confidential: Decentralized Storage Sharing Service for ISP & Datacenters in Europe: Built a decentralized storage system using Biconomy for gasless native meta-transactions. Implemented ERC20 tokens for payments, created single-click multipayment for node operators, and generated reports via Storage API. Built space dashboards through Python APIs and implemented erasure encoding/decoding with GCM-AES encryption/decryption.  3) Cars2Click International: Built a metaverse via Three.js and Spatial.io, representing car showrooms and interiors.  4) Astro Feast: Developed Web3 apps tracking carbon emissions and generating NFT coupons.  5) Duggup (now Profile.fyi): Built a Q&A platform for Engineers' growth with Arpit Bhayani. Managed 8 developers, overseeing UX, tech, and project management, creating an app similar to Quora for engineers.  6) Geodnet :  Supported Geodnet in distributing devices and increasing adoption by implementing technical solutions, optimizing device setup processes.  7 ) Masken Tech : Provided comprehensive training and consulting for Proof-of-Stake (PoS) Cosmos SDK-based validators, focusing on ZK EVM Polygon nodes, including Heimdall and Bor PoS nodes with Validium integration. Trained developers on blockchain fundamentals, including setting up sentry nodes, Kubernetes operators, orchestrators, and relayers to distribute validator power efficiently. Guided on configuring essential Cosmos SDK files such as config.toml, app.toml, priv_validator_key.json, and genesis.json, while ensuring best practices for secure node operation. Supported seamless deployment using Cosmos hubs and empowered client with advanced knowledge of validator architecture and blockchain infrastructure management.
organization_location_7: Charleston, South Carolina Metropolitan Area ¬∑ Remote
position_description_7: Led cross-functional teams to develop innovative fantasy sports products (basketball, baseball, football) for US College and Professional leagues:  1) Real-Time Drafting: Built solo (playing with bots), PVP (player v/s player), and multiplayer drafting (3-15 players) with features like league management, draft room setup, real-time point calculations, game calendar integration, chat, notifications, archived leagues, season points, live schedule & scores via 3rd party, claim tokens, unique team drafting constraint.   2) Stats on Stacks (SoS): Designed a predictive stats module where users forecast player metrics (e.g., rushing yards) with reward multipliers for accuracy. Enabled token claims and built leaderboards.  3) Perfect Picks: Introduced multi-team draft flexibility with solo, PVP, and multiplayer modes.  Core Responsibilities & Achievements:  1) User Research: Conducted user interviews and competitive analysis to refine product features.  2) System Design: Architected scalable microservices leveraging RESTful APIs, Azure Functions, MySQL, MongoDB, and async workflows. Integrated SignalR, WebSocket, Azure Queue Triggers, Redis, B2C and event-driven architecture for real-time updates.  3) Agile Development: Defined user stories, managed backlogs, and coordinated sprints and releases.  4) Real-Time Features: Implemented draft synchronization, auto-pick functionality, and condition-based checks.  5) Leadership: Established product vision, drove collaboration across UX, UI, QA, and marketing, and managed stakeholder alignment.  6) Marketing & Growth: Scaled user adoption through gamification (Draftsy Points) and targeted campaigns.  Led the team to build a scalable fantasy sports platform while managing UX, backend, animation, web , mobile, SRE, and QA teams. Personally involved in hiring and onboarding, I integrated data analytics, real-time features, and user insights to deliver Draftsy's cutting-edge platform, driving innovation in fantasy sports gaming.
position_description_8: As a Solutions Architect at RFOX, I played a key role in documenting and designing systems for existing products, leading the development of innovative projects, managing 3rd party vendor technical teams.  1. Documentation & System Design: Upon joining, I documented backend/frontend, data flow, and infrastructure for products like VALT and Kogs Quest, also created detailed system design diagrams, ensuring technical clarity across teams.  2. Meme Racer Game: Led the development of  NFT-based game where rockets (NFTs) are tracked, transferred, and owned in real-time. This game featured WebSocket-driven real-time gameplay, Redis caching, WAX blockchain integration, and an admin panel for tournament management. Users could purchase NFTs instantly, with rewards granted to the final 8 NFTs out of 888 in circulation.  3. CI/CD Pipelines: Created CI/CD pipelines for Unity games, including VALT and Kogs Quest, optimizing deployments for iPhone, Android, and Quest environments. Integrated Power Automate for automated deployments post-stakeholder approval and testing. Used Terraform for instance rotation, reducing DevOps overhead.  4. Led immersive metaverse and WebXR projects, utilizing LIDAR-based 3D scanning with Polycam to capture real-world spaces and convert them into high-fidelity 3D models for Mozilla Hubs, enabling lifelike metaverse experiences. We designed the Bedrock Passport, a unified identity system allowing secure, seamless access across RFOX products.  5. For large-scale virtual events, We built a WebXR trade show platform through exhaustive system design on Three.js, deploying on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS with ArgoCD and Jenkins) with Reticulum for scalability and handling high concurrency, in combination with Spoke, Dialog ,NearSpark.   6. Led the creation of interoperable Unity games using PlayFab with Azure Functions for cross-platform currency management and Photon for managing high concurrency, ensuring smooth, reliable gameplay.
position_description_9: Working with clients like Tata Communications Limited , DTP, Scotia Bank :  1. TCL Obligation Tracker. : Led the development of an obligation management platform, tracking a previously unmonitored millions of USD obligation. Worked with CFO, VPs, CAs, and the legal department. Managed various contract types, defined roles for approvers, obligation managers, and escalation managers. Implemented workflows, proof tracking, and monthly reminders, ensuring timely compliance.  2. Patent Portfolio Management : Developed a patent portfolio management system using PowerApps. Integrated patent data from OneDrive, allowing seamless access and management. Implemented query filters for efficient data retrieval by dates, country, and inventor. Improved data retrieval and decision-making efficiency for stakeholders.  3. Pre-alerts and Maverick Spend Management : Unified pre-alerts and spend management into a cohesive system, enhancing emergency response and personal spend tracking. Developed an alert system for electricity and procurement emergencies. Integrated with SCM for approvals and created applications for PR and PO generation, improving efficiency by 100%.  4. Trading Platform : Developed DTP using Hyperledger Fabric to transform the agricultural supply chain. Digitized trade documents, including bills of lading and certificates of origin, ensuring regulatory compliance and transparency. Created a tamper-proof ledger to track goods, reducing fraud and enhancing efficiency. Integrated with CouchDB for robust data storage and management, improving overall operational processes.  5. Scotia Bank: Led an automation project to streamline legal and operational workflows. We automated file handling, legal markup retrieval, SBSDR document processing, and implemented VBA and Python scripts for SCOTS, LATAM, K2, and OPICS data. This reduced manual effort, increased data accuracy, and cut processing time by 60%. Improving overall efficiency and compliance.
position_description_10: Worked with clients like Spring Energy, Korn Ferry, Hyundai, Gardiner Bros :  1. Spring Energy (Shell) Data Automation: I spearheaded the automation of data extraction and processing for Spring Energy, automating the retrieval of commercial and DSM account data from WRPC and SRPC portals. We consolidated the data into dynamic Excel sheets, improving accuracy and reducing processing time by 60%, streamlining grid operations reporting.  2. Hyundai Metaverse Customization Project: I led the development of a metaverse platform for Hyundai, enabling users to customize cars with AI-generated colors and patterns. The platform enhanced customer engagement through interactive customization and contests. We used AWS ECS Fargate for deployment, Jenkins for CI/CD, and established the infrastructure with VPCs, subnets, and Portainer.  3. Power Automate and NetSuite Integration for Gardiner Bros: I led the integration of Azure Power Automate with NetSuite Oracle ERP to automate financial processes for a UK client. This streamlined workflows such as invoice generation and payment reconciliation, improving efficiency and reducing manual tasks.   4. Korn Ferry Job Evaluation & Analysis System: I developed a job evaluation system for Korn Ferry that generated organizational charts and analyzed job roles, helping management optimize staffing and organizational structure across SBUs.The system was designed to identify and display negative and positive outliers, high and low step gaps based on JR (Job Role) scores relative to supervisors.  5. Hyperledger Fabric Transaction Scaling Project for Banking Client (Confidential) : I optimized the issuer chain code for a banking client to scale transaction throughput up to 2000 transactions per second on Hyperledger Fabric.  6. Minutes of Meeting Generator for Government Agencies: I developed a meeting minutes generation tool for government agencies in Hindi and Punjabi, automating official documentation and improving operational efficiency.

position_description_1: I am currently working as a freelance Data Science and Machine Learning professional with CRED, where I contribute to data-driven decision-making processes and model development. My role involves analyzing user behavior, transaction patterns, and credit history to develop predictive models that help enhance customer experience and detect anomalies in real time.  Using Python, Pandas, NumPy, and machine learning libraries like Scikit-learn and XGBoost, I build and test algorithms for credit scoring, churn prediction, and personalized offer recommendation systems. I also work with SQL to extract and process structured data and use data visualization tools like Tableau and Matplotlib to present findings to the team.  At CRED, data privacy and efficiency are key, so I also collaborate on writing clean, scalable code and optimizing model performance. Working remotely as a freelancer, I manage my own schedule, meet deadlines independently, and actively communicate with product managers and data engineers.  This opportunity has strengthened my real-world understanding of how data science and ML are applied in fintech platforms. It has also helped me develop strong analytical thinking, problem-solving, and technical communication skills. position_description_8: Topic is Heat Exchanger and Utilities .   In the chemical and process industries, efficient thermal management is essential for both operational efficiency and economic viability. Heat exchangers are the primary devices used to transfer heat between two or more fluids at different temperatures without mixing them. On the other hand, utilities refer to the supporting systems that provide energy and services required for the main processes, such as steam, cooling water, compressed air, and electricity. Together, heat exchangers and utilities form the backbone of industrial energy management systems. Heat exchangers and utilities are critical components of any industrial operation. Their effective design, selection, and management directly affect process efficiency, safety, environmental performance, and operational cost. With the rise in energy demand and sustainability focus, future trends will include advanced materials, digital monitoring, and integrated energy systems to maximize thermal efficiency while minimizing environmental footprint.

headline: Independent Researcher on Parenting & Children.
summary: I am Harpreet and my friends call me Happy Singh. I am passionate about parenting and entrepreneurship.  Over the last four years I have been reading and writing around parenting. I find it extremely funny that we live in a world where parenting is taken for granted and every parent knows so little about a child. We don't understand  - the long term affects of eating food with mobile  - what calling a kid shy does to them  - why are 9/10 kids in South Asia getting glasses  - how does air pollution affect kids  - is mother's love important for a child?  From mid 2022 I started putting out my research as The Curious Parent.  - 5 min Hindi Podcast with 700,000+ listens in 6 months  - 1 min English reels on Instagram as harpreet_thecuriousparent  Before I turned a researcher I was the Founder and CEO of CoCubes, the platform connecting colleges and companies. I spent 12 years of my life building CoCubes with Vibhore who was my room mate at IIT Bombay. CoCubes was acquired in 2016 by Aon Hewitt in an all cash deal. Both Vibhore and I were awarded the IIT Bombay Young Alumni Entrepreneurship Award in 2018.   Penguin published our book on our journey called 'Lets Build a Company'. This became the number 1 bestseller in entrepreneurship category when it was released.  Over the last 8 years I have been a coach and angel investor in 50 odd start-ups including Ola, Ola Electric, Chaayos, Shopkirana, Bombay Shaving Company, Lokal, STOA, Entri and others.  After working with a million students in CoCubes I had realized that graduates 'can't change'. They are like a arrow shot from a bow. The more I researched, the more I found that the key to our adult behavior seemed to lie in our childhood. There exists only 'one kind of child' in this world. A child absorbed in doing something without need of praise, reward or fear. But this child is getting lost in our distracted world full of advertisements, candies and screens. And we need to desperately find that child.  After failing to convince my wife to live in the hills, I live in Mumbai with Bhakti and my daughter Diya. And I spend my time being around children and researching on parenting.
position_description_1: The Curious Parent Community is now over 1 million parents across Instagram and YouTube.  I find it extremely funny that we live in a world where parenting is taken for granted and a parent knows so little about a child. So I am spending my time in finding the OneKindofChild.   I see my friends running around, making time for kids between calls and presentations. I think parents today are busy, but all of them want the best for their child. Most parents won‚Äôt have as much time to spend as I have had.  At the start kids are shaped by their genetics and environment. And the environment (how kids spend their time, who do they play with, which school etc) is determined by the parents.  The idea of the curious parent is to share research on children and parenting which is usable in everyday life.  If you have 60 min this weekend, see this: https://www.thecuriousparent.com/courses If you have 5 min hear this out: https://www.thecuriousparent.com/podcast/my-child-is-shy

headline: Backend Engineer @ CRED ‚Ä¢ Ex - Angel One / Paytm Money  ‚Ä¢ Platform Engineering (Backend)  ‚Ä¢ 2k18-2k22 @ NIT Patna
summary: I‚Äôm Kota Kamesh, a backend-focused software engineer with experience designing and building reliable, high-scale systems across fintech, infrastructure, and platform engineering domains.  My strengths lie in building distributed services with a strong focus on:  Performance & Low Latency  Clean Architecture & Code Quality  Production Readiness (Observability, Resilience, Security)  I've worked extensively with Golang, Kafka, Redis, and PostgreSQL, deploying and scaling microservices in AWS cloud environments. I enjoy solving complex system-level challenges, optimizing data pipelines, and contributing to the backend foundations of user-facing products.  Beyond engineering, I care about working in product-first teams where:  Developers own what they build end-to-end  Systems are designed for resilience and clarity, not just delivery  Continuous learning and impact go hand in hand  üéì B.Tech in Computer Science from NIT Patna (9.05 CGPA) üíº Interned at Sony Research India, Paytm, and MLH üß† Areas of interest: System Design, MLOps, Developer Tooling, and Platform Engineering  Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre building for scale, performance, or the next big product.
position_description_2: Contributed to building AROM, Angel One‚Äôs scalable and high-performance order & risk management platform, serving as PoC for AMX‚ÄìAROM and Omnesys‚ÄìAROM integrations. Designed and implemented core systems like the CPP Forward Flow Layer, Order State Machine, and MPM Feed Consumers to enable real-time order flow and state tracking. Delivered critical margin platform features including Market Protection Price (MPP), Cash & F&O Interop, BSE Stock Derivatives, and Pledge FMEA integration, while also contributing to infra libraries such as Span Library, Scrip Master Poller, Config Management, and Gin Rate Limiter Middleware to improve cross-team reusability.  Enhanced system efficiency and reliability by reducing S3 timeouts (via VPC endpoint), halving deployment times with Go‚Äôs errgroup, and implementing crash-safe async flows. Ensured 99.99% uptime with <5 min MTTD and drove zero critical incidents during AROM rollout through proactive monitoring, metrics, and alerting. Maintained a zero change failure rate via structured testing, validation pipelines, and rigorous release practices, while also collaborating with Product, QA, and FE teams to unblock dependencies and ensure smooth launches. Additionally, contributed to shared backend libraries (rate-limiter, gatekeeper, config tooling), boosting backend velocity and engineering standardization.
position_description_3: Architected and scaled backend systems powering Angel One‚Äôs trading platforms. Built a Kafka consumer pipeline for Margin Maker, enabling batching and concurrent processing to sustain 15k+ TPS at peak. Scaled Margin Service APIs to handle 5k+ TPS each, serving a client base of 3Cr+ users with consistent <1s latency. Designed and implemented a cross-region disaster recovery framework with zero data loss guarantees.  Led development of IPO V2 backend modules including ASBA integration, token caching, push notifications, and BSE callback handling. Improved observability and reliability of AMX systems with alerting, retry mechanisms, and resilient designs. Consistently ensured 99.99% uptime, <30 min MTTR, and zero rollback releases across production systems.
position_description_4: Paytm Money, is a wholly owned subsidiary of Paytm, which is one of the largest investment and wealth management app which has more than 6 million downloads all over India.   In Paytm Money, I worked as a SDE Intern (Backend) in the Data & Discovery Team which is the central hub for providing the required data and search facilities to the end user. During my tenure, I got a chance to work on different microservices that are maintained by the team which are used daily by millions of users in scale. I worked on developing new features and solving bugs for the existing projects to enhance the user experience.   As a part of the internship, I am primarily involved in the following   projects :-  üëâ Multi Lingual Data Search Engine: A Data Search Engine Designed to support autocomplete search related to stocks which supports 11 different languages.  üëâ Data Feed Mux : A Data Feed Multiplexer which acts as a proxy between the user application and Exchange Server to subscribe and publish the data packets related to stocks in real time with the help of web sockets.  üëâ ElastAlerts : An Alert System which is responsible to send the slack notifications to particular channels when there is any detection of spike in the requests, error messages occurred by continuously analyzing the logs stored in the index of elastic search.  üëâ Data Periscope : An Internal Data API Service which is used to send the stock information data to various internal teams ( Eg: Customer Service team ) in Paytm Money  In my internship period, I solved critical bugs and developed new features to the above mentioned projects as per the business needs from the product team.

headline: Product Manager at CRED Investments
summary: I‚Äôm a technical product management leader with a 10-year track record of delivering great products at both startups and public companies. I have a passion for delivering value to customers to help transform their businesses. I enjoy figuring out how to apply technology to solve business problems and thrive in entrepreneurial environments where teams work closely together to build great software. I‚Äôve led the development of many successful software products from the ground up, including web & mobile applications as well as AI & data science products.  I have extensive management experience leading and mentoring both business and engineering teams in fast-paced, agile software development environments. I‚Äôve managed distributed engineering teams located on multiple continents including North America, South America, Asia, and Europe. I foster collaboration to quickly and efficiently deliver value.  I have deep technical skills, including engineering experience, architecture design, programming skills, and experience collaborating closely with developers, software architects, and technical leaders to deliver world-class products.

HealthOS improved speed to market for the commercial, Medicare, and Medicaid markets while also reducing cost of delivery.  - Led R&D funnel for operational and clinical initiatives, most recently focusing on value-based care and payment innovation and Generative AI and LLM use cases (Medical Information Extraction, Conversational AI assistant, Prior Authorization, Clinical Note Generation e.g. SOAP).

Sales and sales operations teams use it to accelerate deals, drive customer retention and for cross and upsell initiatives. Legal and finance teams use it to reduce risk, drive compliance and keep every contract in a single, easily accessible place. Customers include: CenturyLink, McKesson, NCR, Comcast, and Hewlett Packard Enterprise. As COO, I scaled operations to support business growth from $350M to $2.4B in assets under management.  - Built out back office & hired and trained CFO and CTO. - Established an integrated analytics and document management repository for investment research. - Implemented a general ledger based investor reporting platform.  As Director of Research, I evaluated private investment companies, and served on Barlow's investment committee where we were responsible for constructing $25M to $1B portfolios on behalf of institutional clients.  On the product side, I designed systems and led development teams that built the exposure reporting platform underlying the firm‚Äôs risk metrics, a portfolio valuation and shareholder accounting system used to value and report on over $3B of investments, and a time series analysis tool for scenario planning and pro forma projections.

headline: Senior SDET | Building Test Tools & Automation Platforms | CI/CD | API & Backend Testing | Java | Jenkins | Rest Assured | Quality Engineering
summary: I‚Äôm a Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) with over 7 years of experience in designing test automation frameworks, building internal QA tools, and enabling shift-left quality across backend and API-first systems.  I‚Äôm deeply passionate about solving complex engineering challenges through test automation, and I believe in proving concepts through hands-on experimentation. I‚Äôm a lifelong learner who thrives on staying ahead of the curve‚Äîrecently exploring AI/ML applications in testing for smarter, faster, and more adaptive quality solutions.  My core expertise lies in building scalable test infrastructure using Java, Rest Assured, Selenium, and TestNG, backed by experience with CI/CD integration (Jenkins, GitHub Actions), backend validation (MySQL, MongoDB), and performance testing (Gatling).  I‚Äôve led the creation of automation frameworks for both UI and API testing, developed custom tools like PR gating systems and MySQL utilities, and implemented centralized reporting using ReportPortal. I take pride in mentoring engineers, reducing production regressions, and building reliable test ecosystems that scale with product growth.  Tools & Tech: Java, Rest Assured, Selenium, TestNG, Jenkins, MySQL, MongoDB, ReportPortal, Docker, GitHub Actions, Gatling, AI-based test case generation

Platform & Tooling ‚Äì CRED ‚Äì Built a PR checks framework (GitHub + Jenkins), boosting pre-merge defect detection by ~50%. ‚Äì Developed a MySQL utility (HikariCP) for parallel DB access in test automation. ‚Äì Set up central test reporting via ReportPortal + Jira across 10+ teams.

headline: Data Engineering @ CRED | Ex- DE-3 & SDE-2 @ slice | BCSE Jadavpur University
summary: Currently working as a part of Core Data Engineering in CRED Data Platform team.  Previously as Data Engineer 3 at Slice, I have built and optimized many Spark-based data pipelines running on EMR and Databricks, orchestrated with Airflow. Handled real-time fraud detection through Kafka and Python stream processing to ensure fast and accurate decision-making. Worked on developing a robust data governance and data access control platform, including automating the identification and securing of sensitive PII data. I have contributed to various cost optimization initiatives to streamline operations and reduce expenses across our data infrastructure. Additionally, I have handled multiple large scale data and data-infrastructure migration projects.  Previously, as an SDE 1 & 2, I built and managed credit risk backend services using frameworks like Flask, Django, and FastAPI, while collaborating closely with credit risk analysts to deliver data-driven solutions. I also worked in deploying real-time ML based transaction underwriting feature at Slice.  I hold a Bachelor's in Computer Science & Engineering from Jadavpur University and have a solid foundation in Python development. I‚Äôm passionate about writing clean, maintainable code and always strive to build systems that are scalable, efficient, and easy to understand.  My technical interests include Scalable System Design, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning. I‚Äôm always eager to learn and contribute to innovative, data-driven solutions.
position_description_1: Handling Core Data Engineering in Data Platform team.
position_description_2: Building robust data governance platform and ways to automatically identify and secure sensitive (PII) information.
position_description_3: Building data pipelines using Spark, Airflow and Databricks (streaming + batch). Cost optimization measures. Data governance. Data access control. Sensitive data identification and handling.

summary: From AI Curious to AI Confident: Empowering Leaders to Guide Tomorrow!  I run the flagship program ‚ÄòAI for Non-Tech Leaders‚Äô, designed for CXOs, Founders & Senior Managers who want to harness AI without technical overwhelm. What truly sets me apart today is my hands-on mastery in AI, growth strategy, digital marketing, organic lead generation, and sales acceleration‚Äîdeveloped not just through consulting, but by building my own business from the ground up.   I specialize in AI, Growth Hacking, Organic Marketing, SEO, Answer Engine Optimization (AEO), and conversion-driven content, helping brands move from invisible to unstoppable.  My approach blends the discipline of engineering with the agility of modern marketing. I work with founders, CXOs, and teams to unlock their growth potential using sustainable, search-first strategies that increase traffic, capture intent, and drive revenue.  I'm deeply passionate about technology that drives positive change, and I actively support businesses with a mission. Having witnessed countless leaders struggle with AI adoption‚Äînot because they lack capability, but because they need strategic guidance‚ÄîI created a focused program to bridge this gap. Through "AI for Non-Tech Leaders," I help executives transform AI anxiety into competitive advantage, guiding teams toward intelligent automation without getting lost in technical complexity.  As a CEO, speaker, and AI strategist, I bring the unique perspective of someone who's built businesses from both sides‚Äîas a tech expert who speaks the language of growth and as a leader who's navigated every stage of scaling.  If your organization is exploring smarter, organic strategies for digital growth‚ÄîI'd be happy to connect and share insights. Let's start a conversation at anupma@akshri.com.

By leveraging existing business frameworks adapted for startups to help cross the "5 Chasms"‚Äã that have proven as points of failure for startups. headline: Machine Learning Engineer - CRED(PREFR)
summary: With a solid foundation in Data Science and Machine Learning, my journey has led me to CreditVidya as a Machine Learning Engineer. Here, my role revolves around enhancing loan approval processes using a blend of bureau and alternative data alongside sophisticated risk modules.  My expertise lies in creating impactful AI solutions, evidenced by the development of variables based on customer cash flow data to pinpoint over-leveraged individuals. This has significantly improved risk assessments, all while I've mastered tools like TensorFlow and Keras, and languages such as Python, contributing to a data-driven, customer-centric approach in the fintech space.
position_description_1: -	Based on the cash flow data of customers, analysed and designed variables that flag any undesirable customers who might pass the decision strategy otherwise. -	Using cash flow variables and manual intervention, we are able to identify customers that might be over leveraged because the bureau might not reflect any recent loans they have taken. -	Programmed a way in which some aspects of the decision strategy for a particular set of users can directly be added and controlled from config. on fly without the need of changing the code and deploying a new JAR in production. -    Based on the bureau and alternate data of the customers, developed and programmed variables that are part of the decision making strategy and are also used in building the risk models. - Programmed and integrated variables derived from bureau and alternate data (e.g., SMS, AppData) into the decision- making strategy, enhancing risk models and loan approval processes. -Developed an ETL pipeline to efficiently read and analyze large datasets, reducing data fetching time from 1-2 days to a 1-2 minutes, enabling timely, data-driven decisions. -Created real-time dashboards for data visualizations, empowering stakeholders with better understanding and insights from the data.
position_description_2: - Designed, Developed and Integrated Conversational AI chatbots on the websites for the Banks helping users resolve their queries easily and apply quickly for Personal loan, Credit card applications etc. - Designed and developed NLP classification models using Simple Transformer Model with high volume datasets like perfios statements.

headline: Detection & Response @ CRED | Threat Intelligence | Security Operations | GSoC | CERT-In
summary: I'm a self-taught, cybersecurity engineer with a relentless drive to understand threats from every angle‚Äîand stop them in their tracks. I specialize in detecting, investigating, and responding to threats across cloud, endpoint, SaaS, and insider threat surfaces.  I analyze threat intelligence, simulate adversary behavior, and proactively hunt using frameworks like MITRE ATT&CK. I focus on real-world TTPs to sharpen detection logic and improve organization's security readiness.  I collaborate closely with stakeholders across security, compliance, and engineering to align operations with risk and regulatory needs, driving initiatives in Cloud and Data Security. headline: Entrepreneur, Independent Consultant, Co-Founder and CEO at Aggois (subsidiary of Agribid)
position_description_1: Aggois is subsidiary of Agribid and works on financial intermediation model, doing B2B partnerships with NBFCs for supply of money and tie-ups with channel partners (agribusiness transacting with farmers) to onboard farmers through them (B2B2C approach) for infusion (demand) of money. Products that Aggois offers caters to farmers' financial requirements round the year. There are 2 phases for farmers - cultivation phase and post harvest phase. During cultivation phase, Aggois provides input on credit financing and during post harvest phase, depending on whether farmer's produce gets released to market instantly or in a deferred manner, Aggois provides receivable financing or financing against storage. Aggois' post harvest products helps farmers opt for higher income channels (private institution buyer, government MSP, ability to store and sell at right time) against default APMC channel and by opting for input on credit financing, they can shun relationship with local money lenders. Value for channel partners is effective working capital infusion to grow business and value for financial partners is building high quality agri portfolio and potentially deploying priority sector lending money for the same. Aggois has disbursed ~5.7 Cr of loans with NPA/delinquency under 2%. It has worked with 5 NBFCs, 15 PACS, 8 channel partners, 5 commodities, 4 geographies and 750 farmers.

headline: Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Solutions Architect |  Node.js, TypeScript, Python | Fintech | AWS | üåç Remote Contract (No Visa Required)
summary: üåç Location: Brazil | Working with US companies since 2020 ‚è∞ Availability: EST/PST business hours üíº Open to: Contract, B2B, 1099, C2C arrangements ‚úÖ No visa sponsorship needed - Direct contractor engagement  Senior Software Engineer with 19 years of experience in software development, solution architecture, and technical leadership. I specialize in delivering high-impact solutions across fintech, enterprise technology, and entertainment industries through remote collaboration.  üéØ Proven Remote Delivery Delivered measurable business impact working with international teams: 70% cloud cost reductions, 10x revenue growth through automation, and modernization projects completed months ahead of schedule. Deep expertise in Financial Services, Payment Processing, Banking Technology, and RegTech compliance solutions.  üöÄ AI/ML & Engineering Building intelligent systems using LangChain, Python, Node.js, and TypeScript. Developing multi-channel AI agents for fintech applications, Generative AI implementations, and serverless ML architectures that drive measurable improvements in user experience and operational cost optimization.  üß† Technical Leadership Staff-level technical leadership across distributed teams spanning multiple time zones. Architected solutions for Brazil's largest bank, built instant card issuance platforms, and created multi-tenant SaaS systems serving 12,500+ practices with enterprise-grade security and compliance.  üè¢ Fintech & Enterprise Expertise From founding engineer at fintech startups to senior positions at global corporations. Built Payment Processing and Banking Technology platforms collaborating daily with InfoSec teams in the US and CloudOps in India.  üí° Core Technologies - Python, LangChain, AI/ML, MLOps ‚Äì 2+ years (current focus) - Node.js, TypeScript, JavaScript ‚Äì 10+ years - React, Frontend Architecture ‚Äì 6+ years - Cloud Architecture (AWS, Azure, GCP) ‚Äì 7+ years - DevOps, CI/CD, Serverless ‚Äì 5+ years - Remote Team Leadership ‚Äì 5+ years across US, Europe, LATAM  üìû Let's Connect Available for Corp-to-Corp (C2C) engagements and direct contracts. I maintain US business hours with extensive experience in remote collaboration tools and async workflows.
position_description_1: Development of advanced AI agent platform serving multi-channel communication across Slack, Microsoft Teams, WhatsApp, and REST endpoints. Architect end-to-end Artificial Intelligence solution featuring intelligent preprocessing of diverse file formats (audio, images, PDFs, Word, JSON, CSV) using LangChain framework and Large Language Models.  Built comprehensive token cost optimization system with automated monitoring, reducing AI operational expenses by 40% across large-scale operations. Implemented MCP (Model Context Protocol) server architecture managing proprietary API endpoints, creating seamless integration between internal Financial Services systems and AI processing workflows.  The platform revolutionizes how financial teams interact with investment data through Natural Language Processing, enabling complex queries while maintaining enterprise-grade security and RegTech compliance standards required in the fintech industry.  Technologies: Python, LangChain, Large Language Models (LLMs), Generative AI, MCP Server, Multi-channel APIs, Natural Language Processing, Financial Services APIs, Token Optimization
position_description_2: Lead software modernization initiatives for Som Livre, Sony Music Entertainment's largest Latin American subsidiary, serving millions of users globally. Originally hired to maintain legacy systems during the Globo-to-Sony acquisition, evolved to architect and rebuild the entire technology infrastructure to meet Sony's global enterprise standards for security, scalability, and compliance.  I spearheaded the complete transformation of two critical legacy systems into four modern, enterprise-grade platforms that now operate under international oversight with InfoSec teams in the United States and CloudOps in India. All systems are architected using SOLID principles, clean architecture patterns, and modern DevOps practices to meet Sony's global deployment standards.  Current platform portfolio includes Purchases, an internal procurement system with multi-level approval workflows managing purchase orders, contracts, and vendor relationships using Node.js with SQL Server and automated CI/CD pipelines. The Contracts platform integrates with Adobe Sign APIs to manage complex signature workflows with hierarchical approval chains and compliance tracking. Tapes serves as a highly scalable music catalog management system utilizing AWS Lambda and serverless relational databases to handle the company's extensive music library for consultation and distribution.  Most recently, I developed an AI-powered Artist Analysis system that monitors social media content of contracted artists using machine learning algorithms to identify potential contract compliance issues and brand risk factors. This intelligent scanning solution represents the cutting-edge intersection of entertainment industry compliance and artificial intelligence.  The modernization project was completed three months ahead of schedule with approximately 70% reduction in cloud infrastructure costs while dramatically improving system reliability, security posture, and scalability to support Sony's global operations.
position_description_3: Served as Founder Engineer and Tech Lead for OmniContent, a revolutionary AI-powered video analysis platform that transforms how brands create and optimize User Generated Content at scale. Led technical development while maintaining concurrent responsibilities at Som Livre, building the complete solution from architecture conception to production deployment.  As the founding technical architect, I designed and implemented an end-to-end automated video processing pipeline using AWS serverless architecture. The system processes thousands of videos daily through a sophisticated three-stage workflow: audio extraction and MP3 conversion, speech-to-text transcription with database storage, and intelligent frame analysis using LangChain and AI models.  The core innovation involved developing a Python-based processing engine integrated with AWS SNS/SQS for queue management and Lambda functions for scalable AI analysis. The system automatically extracts video frames at calculated intervals, combines visual analysis with transcribed audio content, and generates comprehensive video quality scores based on customizable briefing prompts using advanced LangChain implementations.  This AI-driven solution revolutionized Final Level's business model, enabling clients like Mercado Livre, Nivea, and McDonald's to scale from 200 videos per month to over 2,000 videos monthly while expanding operations across multiple Latin American countries. The platform's automated approval workflows and intelligent scoring system dramatically reduced manual review time and improved content quality consistency.  I led a cross-functional team of 3 engineers, managing both technical architecture decisions and team coordination while ensuring seamless integration with existing marketing workflows. The solution's success positioned Final Level as a leader in scalable content creation technology, fundamentally changing how major brands approach video marketing campaigns.
position_description_4: Joined ChiroTouch, a leading cloud-based chiropractic practice management and EHR software serving over 12,500 practices nationwide, as my first international engineering role. Worked on their multi-tenant SaaS healthcare platform integrating electronic health records, practice management, billing, and patient engagement tools.  I focused on billing modules and patient scheduling systems within their scalable Node.js backend architecture deployed on Kubernetes. The billing module required complex integration with insurance APIs to handle claims processing, eligibility verification, and reimbursement workflows for thousands of healthcare providers. The patient scheduling system managed appointment coordination across multiple time zones with real-time availability updates and automated reminder notifications.  The technical architecture utilized schema-based multi-tenancy, allowing thousands of chiropractic practices to operate independently within the same database infrastructure while ensuring complete data isolation and security. I worked extensively with insurance integration APIs, implementing automated claim submissions and real-time eligibility checks that streamlined billing processes.  This role marked a significant professional milestone as my first remote international experience, requiring adaptation to asynchronous collaboration across multiple time zones with a multicultural engineering team. The development environment emphasized enterprise-grade practices with comprehensive CI/CD pipelines, automated testing suites, code linting, and rigorous code review processes ensuring high-quality deployments to production systems handling sensitive healthcare data.  I contributed to React and TypeScript frontend components while working with MySQL databases using Sequelize ORM, gaining deep experience in building compliant medical software that meets HIPAA requirements and healthcare industry standards.
position_description_5: Joined Lightstream, a live streaming platform, in a part-time DevOps role focused on deployment automation and developer productivity improvements while maintaining my full-time responsibilities at ChiroTouch. This strategic engagement allowed me to deepen my DevOps expertise and explore infrastructure automation in a different industry context.  I developed custom automation tools to streamline the development workflow, including systems that automatically analyzed pull requests, identified commit patterns, and posted intelligent summaries to Slack channels for improved team visibility. These tools reduced manual deployment overhead and enhanced communication between development and operations teams.  My primary contribution involved creating Slack agents that automated various DevOps processes, from deployment notifications to infrastructure monitoring alerts. I also led the cloud infrastructure migration from Microsoft Azure to Google Cloud Platform, implementing CI/CD pipelines, configuring deployment YAML files, and securely transferring secrets to GitHub Secrets management.  The migration project was completed successfully within the established timeline, enabling Lightstream to benefit from Google Cloud's performance improvements and cost optimization incentives. This part-time role significantly expanded my DevOps toolkit and automation expertise, complementing my full-stack development background with infrastructure and deployment automation skills.  The experience provided valuable exposure to live streaming infrastructure challenges, real-time system monitoring, and the unique scaling requirements of media platforms while developing practical automation solutions that improved developer productivity.
position_description_6: Joined Brazil's largest bank initially as a consultant through Contrate um Programador, quickly transitioning to full-time engineer role due to project complexity and performance. Led critical modernization initiatives for the bank's investment platform, specifically focusing on the CDB (Certificate of Bank Deposit) module that serves corporate and retail clients nationwide.  I played a key role in refactoring legacy investment systems, implementing database migrations, and architecting scalable solutions to handle the massive transaction volumes typical of Brazil's largest financial institution. The backend modernization involved building microservices using both Node.js and Python, deployed on AWS Lambda for automatic scaling and cost optimization.  One of the most challenging aspects was implementing microfrontend architecture using Angular, allowing different teams to develop and deploy independent frontend modules while maintaining a cohesive user experience across the investment platform. This approach enabled faster development cycles and reduced deployment risks for critical financial services.  The database migration work required careful planning and execution to ensure zero downtime for live investment transactions, implementing gradual data migration strategies and maintaining data integrity throughout the modernization process. I also contributed to performance optimization initiatives that improved response times for investment queries and transaction processing.  Working at Banco do Brasil provided deep exposure to enterprise-scale financial systems, regulatory compliance requirements, and the technical challenges of serving millions of customers with mission-critical investment services.
position_description_7: Founded and operated contrateumprogramador.com, a custom software development company serving diverse industries with complex, full-stack solutions. Built the business from concept to established operation, managing both solo development projects and teams of remote and on-site developers. The company continues operating today, though I've transitioned from full-time involvement to strategic oversight.  I developed three major flagship applications that demonstrate technical and business complexity across different sectors. For the agricultural sector, I built comprehensive farm management software integrating financial management, harvest forecasting, and annual planning systems using modern web technologies. In hospitality, I created an end-to-end hotel management platform unifying website sales, financial operations, staff payroll, restaurant management, and internal task coordination including housekeeping workflows.  One of my most technically challenging projects involved developing an optimized inventory management system for specialized hardware components using QR code scanning technology for precise lot-based control and traceability.  The diverse client base exposed me to numerous technology stacks and architectural patterns through maintenance and enhancement projects. This experience provided hands-on expertise with React, Angular, Node.js, Python, AWS cloud services, CI/CD pipelines, PostgreSQL, and various NoSQL databases. Working across multiple client codebases taught me to quickly understand different architectural decisions and adapt to various development methodologies.  This entrepreneurial experience led to consulting opportunities with major institutions, including Banco do Brasil, where my expertise in modern web technologies and scalable system design became highly valued for enterprise-level projects.
organization_title_8: Senior Software Engineer & Tech Lead | Founder Engineer - Instant Card Issuance
position_description_8: Led all technology initiatives for white-label and private-label card solutions serving banks and retailers. As Founder Engineer, conceptualized and built revolutionary instant card issuance platform that eliminated traditional manufacturing delays, enabling real-time credit card production with chip and magnetic stripe technology.  As Founder Engineer of the instant card issuance platform, I pioneered a breakthrough solution that replaced traditional factory-based production with desktop printing technology. I architected the complete end-to-end system including web platform, real-time processing engine, and printer integration via Java applets. The solution included a subscription-based SaaS model with hardware leasing of desktop card printers and software licensing.  I developed a real-time card production workflow that could produce fully functional cards with digital design, chip programming, magnetic stripe encoding, and physical printing in under 2 minutes. This required building secure communication protocols between the web interface and specialized card printing hardware for EMV chip and mag-stripe integration.  Beyond the flagship product, I designed and maintained all client integration systems, customizing data transmission protocols for diverse banking and retail file formats. I built a flexible data processing engine that handled multiple client layouts and transmission requirements across white-label and private-label solutions while managing the complete technology infrastructure supporting real-time card production.  This technology transformed card issuance from a days-long manufacturing process to instant, on-demand production, creating new revenue streams through our hardware-software subscription model
organization_location_9: S√£o Paulo, S√£o Paulo, Brazil ¬∑ On-site
position_description_9: Architected and developed end-to-end automation platform that transformed card production operations for healthcare providers, gyms, and private label retail clients. Single-handedly built comprehensive system replacing manual Microsoft Access workflows, resulting in 10x revenue growth while maintaining same headcount.  Technical Innovation & System Architecture: Designed automated FTP-to-production pipeline processing client data files and generating print-ready layouts for card production. Built web-based processing system with automated overnight batch jobs, replacing 50-minute manual process with 3-minute automated workflow. Implemented real-time tracking and workflow management across entire production lifecycle from data ingestion to final delivery. Created seamless integration between web platform and card printers using Java applets and scheduled cron jobs for autonomous production cycles. Developed comprehensive kit assembly coordination system, automating welcome package production and shipping workflows.  Business Impact & Performance Optimization: Delivered 10x company revenue growth through operational automation while maintaining same workforce size. Achieved 94% processing time reduction (50 minutes to 3 minutes) through database optimization and efficient batch processing. Established complete production traceability system enabling real-time client reporting and quality assurance. Scaled system to handle multiple client types including major healthcare providers, fitness chains, and private label retailers.  Technical Leadership: Led 5-person cross-functional team while handling all development work independently, coordinating process implementation and requirement definitions across business stakeholders.  Technologies: PHP, Laravel, MySQL, Java Applets, FTP Integration, Automated Batch Processing, Cron Jobs, Card Printer APIs, Real-time Tracking Systems

headline: security @CRED | macOS researcher
summary: Threat Detection Engineer | macOS Security Research | Blackhat Trainer | AI & Automation | Malware Analyst | Threat Hunter | DFIR | SOAR SME |   SIEM(Splunk/ELK/Arcsight) | SANS GIME | C|EHv11 | eJPT | eCTHPv2  | GIAC Advisory Board Member
position_description_2: - As a Threat Detection Engineer propose detection ideas based on priority threats from TI. - Develop and manage use case for SOC (Splunk, Arcsight & Sentinel) - Creating correlation rules (Risk based, ML based) to detect emerging threats. - Maintain, fine-tune, optimise and troubleshoot search queries and its execution. - Perform Structured and Unstructured Threat Hunting using TTPs. (MITRE Framework) - Contributing in suggesting SOAR Playbook ideas, creation of advanced playbook using python and helping team in device integration and plugin development.

headline: Bringing India onchain I Coinbase
summary: You're here for the story. Here it goes-  I was born and brought up in a small city in India where I first hand witnessed disparity between different classes of society.   In the first few years of my professional career, I tried to bridge those disparities by using the power of finance in catalyzing urban reform. I worked with Governments and Multilateral agencies such as the World Bank and Asian Development Bank to set up financial institutions committed to developing smart infrastructure in Africa and Southeast Asia.  A firm believer in capital for social good and equitable education for every child, I later helped raise funds from individuals, corporations, and foundations for a global nonprofit. My passion for creating social change drove me towards setting up two non-profit organizations that work towards empowering the underprivileged community.   In 2019, I was selected as a part of the LGT fellowship cohort- a group of ten changemakers working around the globe to help create social change. In late 2020, I got sold on the promise of decentralization and permissionless systems spent the next year or so building multiple onchain products and communities. The products I've built have won grants from foundations of all major blockchains.  My vision for the next decade is to build at the frontier of technology and create protocols and structures to bring India and the world onchain.  When I am not talking about bringing the world onchain or sustainable social impact, I am talking about football, rock music, or my cross-country travels.   Interested in knowing more, ping me on twitter @saxenasaheb and we‚Äôll set up some time to chat.

This project aims at forecasting the spread of COVID-19 in India and recommending to the user how safe will it be to travel to a particular location.  Studied and Developed Statistical Models (ARIMA, SARIMA), Compartmental Models (SIR, SEIR) and DL Time Series models for COVID-19 Forecasting. Contributed in the development of a precision agriculture technique (Patent pending). Built a Deep learning-based segmentation and classification model to, first segment out the hair and face part from the images and then classify face shape into round, oval, or square and to detect the hairstyle as straight, curly or wavy hair. To train and evaluate the models we collected image data from some open-source repositories and also scraped some data from google.

headline: Staff Security Engineer @CRED | DefCon CloudVillage Instructor | Black Hat Arsenal Presenter | Cloud & AI Security | AWS Community Builder
summary: Staff Security Engineer and published security researcher specializing in cloud-native attack vectors and AI-powered defense systems.  I architect security for CRED's fintech infrastructure serving millions, while conducting cutting-edge research on cloud platform vulnerabilities. My work sits at the intersection of offensive security research and defensive security engineering at scale.  Published Research & Discoveries: - AWS Security: Discovered CloudTrail detection bypass via AppStream, GuardDuty container runtime evasion, and novel ECS task metadata credential exfiltration techniques - GCP Security: Uncovered privilege escalation via Cloud Workstation shared sessions - demonstrated complete account takeover - Built first Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers enabling autonomous AI-driven cloud security remediation - Research presented at BlackHat Arsenal USA, DefCon CloudVillage, NoNameCon  Engineering Leadership at CRED: - Secure 50+ AWS accounts processing millions of daily transactions with zero critical findings across 55+ audits (PCI DSS 4.0, RBI, ISO 27001) - Lead threat modeling for 15+ critical platforms (UPI, lending, payments etc) - implemented 110+ preventive controls - Drive security strategy while maintaining hands-on technical depth - Built open-source tools:  aws-security-mcp, IMDShift (imdsv2 migration), DIAL (sub-5s misconfiguration detection)  Technical Expertise: - Cloud Security: AWS, GCP, Kubernetes (CKA), container runtime security, infrastructure as code - Offensive Security: Red team collaboration, vulnerability research. - Security Engineering: Threat modelling, vulnerability management, security automation, DevSecOps, Python, NodeJS, Terraform - AI/ML Security: Created first MCP Server implementation for cloud security, enabling LLMs (Claude, GPT) to autonomously query and fix AWS misconfigurations, translate security requirements to code  From bypassing cloud detection mechanisms to building AI that fixes security issues autonomously - I transform security research into scalable defensive solutions.  AWS Community Builder (Security) | Synack Red Team Alumni | Bug bounty: Apple, AWS, GCP, AT&T, PaloAltoNetworks  Open to Staff/Principal roles where I can push the boundaries of cloud security through research and engineering.
position_description_1: - Container Security Architecture: Leading container security initiatives across ECS/EKS - implemented image scanning pipelines, runtime protection with Upwind Enterprise, and discovered critical vulnerabilities including AWS GuardDuty container runtime detection bypass and ECS task metadata credential exfilteration  - Security Automation & AI: Pioneered AI-driven security with Model Context Protocol servers - aws-security-mcp enables LLMs to autonomously detect AWS misconfigurations, aws-inspector-mcp automates vulnerability management. Reduced operational costs by $15,000/month through automation  - Open Source Contributions: Published MCP servers on GitHub enabling natural language security queries. Developed automated attack surface management tool for proactive public exposure detection across AWS infrastructure  - Security Evangelist: Speaker at DefCon CloudVillage demonstrating UEBA on AWS infrastructure using LLMs. Leading research on solving cloud security challenges with AI - translating natural language queries to optimized security context

Won 1st place in AWS Security GameDay competing against 140+ participants from 60 teams  - Published critical security research: Discovered AWS AppStream CloudTrail bypass, AWS CloudShell container breakout, GCP Cloud Workstations privilege escalation - research featured in AWS Security Digest and CloudSec newsletters  - Architected enterprise security frameworks: AWS EKS Security Baseline, Cloud Security Policy, Common Control Framework, UAT Security Guidelines - adopted across multiple engineering teams  - Open sourced DIAL (Did I Alert Lambda?) - centralized security monitoring detecting misconfigurations in < 3 seconds. Presented at BlackHat USA 2023, Ekoparty demonstrating real-time cloud security at scale  - Led M&A security for 4+ acquisitions including Happay (expense management), Kuvera (wealth management), and CreditVidya (lending platform) - ensured compliance with RBI and PCI DSS mandates without blocking business velocity  - built, processed and optimised! -  established infrastructure security review process, reduced operational costs by $10,000/month through tool consolidation

headline: JOHNAIC | Qure.ai | PyTorch | AI
summary: Sasank is a core AI researcher and engineer who worked on multiple high impact AI projects like Qure.aI and PyTorch. His passion lies at the intersection of AI and opensource technologies. He now builds hardware to democratize AI access!  Follow me on twitter: https://twitter.com/sasank51. I'm lot more active on twitter :)
position_description_1: Overview of JOHNAIC product:  https://johnaic.com/_static/slides/JOHNAIC.pdf and here is the spec sheet for it: https://johnaic.com/_static/slides/JOHNAIC-spec.pdf.  A quick video can be seen here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mw-iAhJ4VXU  And finally here are some benchmarks: https://github.com/chsasank/device-benchmarks
position_description_2: As a founding member of Qure.ai, he led and contributed to developing AI for healthcare. He is instrumental is development of qER, a neuro AI tool. He publishes his work in scientific conferences, journals, qure's blog and his own personal blog. He is particularly proud of his publication in The Lancet.  He contributed significantly to PyTorch, a deep learning framework used by many organizations around the world. He had also made numerous contributions to opensource and maintains an active profile on github. Some of his contributions include Keras, SimpleITK, Scikit-Learn libaries. His own projects on image rectification and feature extraction are popular.
position_description_3: Housing.com, a real estate tech startup from his alma mater (IITB), inspired him and other kids from his school to start up. So he joined it after his schooling. During his short stint at housing, he worked on applying NLP on their discussion forum - IREF.  As you probably know, text in web forums are especially noisy and quite hard to work with. So, he had to work around these constraints to do some cool AI stuff on that text. Another theme of his work at housing is classification/summarization of the text - keyphrase extraction and text summarization. If you think about it, summarization is some sort of unsupervised classification. His techniques at Housing were completely 'classical'. He got exposed to Deep Learning at the end of his stint.  Unfortunately, he had to leave Housing due to its financial troubles. His next stint, Qure.ai, turns out to be super interesting!
position_description_4: During his UG, Sasank always wanted to go to grad school and do some science. So, he wanted to try his hand at research at a western university. He ended up getting this internship at center for optics, photonics and lasers to work on optical fiber communication systems. He got a chance to work on some deep research on optimizing these systems from an information theory point of view. Exact research topic is: "coded modulation for coherent optical communication systems".
position_description_5: Since his childhood, Sasank was always interested in math. In IITB, MA 105 - Intro to Calculus, caught his imagination with the amount of rigor and formalism possible in math. He loved the course so much so that he went on to complete a minor in Math - considered one of the toughest (and boring) minor of his school.  He also wanted to pass on his love for Math by teaching his juniors. Luckily, Math department looks out for senior UGs along with grad students as TAs. So that's how he got opportunity to tutor 40 strength class once a week helping them solve tutorial sheets and clarifying doubts among. He also scrutinized homework and answer sheets.  He did this for about 3/4 courses. This earned him a handsome (for a poor student) stipend that eventually allowed him to buy cool tech - his first smartphone.

headline: SDE-2 at Groww | B.Tech CSE'23, IIIT Nagpur
summary: I am a Software Development Engineer II with a strong foundation in designing and developing robust, scalable fintech platforms. My technical expertise spans Java, Python, Spring Boot, Kafka, Redis, Kubernetes, MySQL, Bigtable (NoSQL), Temporal, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with a growing specialization in AI/ML integration and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems for enterprise applications.  At Groww, I serve as a senior engineer in the Account Management team, where I developed a high-performance product-level blocking platform handling over 600K requests per minute with a P99 response time of just 8ms. Leveraging my deep understanding of distributed systems and messaging frameworks like Kafka, I've engineered transformative solutions including a multi-layered Account Aggregator platform that improved FID by over 15% and a secure biometric-based account recovery flow that reduced CS tickets on account recovery by 85% .  AI Innovation & Research: Beyond traditional backend engineering, I'm passionate about AI-driven solutions. I've architected a personal AI coding assistant using advanced Prompt Engineering techniques, built a complete RAG pipeline with LangChain for contextual code understanding, and deployed Mistral LLM locally using Ollama for offline operation.  I've also led process innovations, such as designing a Temporal-based orchestrator with state machine capabilities for workflow checkpointing and implementing a centralized paywall system impacting ~300K annual transactions. My leadership extends to mentoring software engineering interns through successful PPO conversions and authoring comprehensive technical documentation that improves team onboarding and system maintainability.  In my previous role as SDE at Groww, I spearheaded the complete FnO onboarding flow revamp, improving Day 2 Onboarding by 10% and Day 3 Onboarding by 15%, while reducing document collection and verification TAT from 30 to 5 minutes. I also developed regulatory-compliant dormancy systems serving 70L+ users with 20K+ daily activations.  Let's connect to discuss innovative solutions, fintech architecture, AI integration in enterprise systems, and the power of automation in building reliable, high-performance platforms.
