headline: Director of Engineering @ Scaler | Ex- Qubole, Directi, Sapient
summary: With over 11 years of experience in building high-quality tech products, I‚Äôve navigated a diverse career journey‚Äîfrom working as a full-stack developer for 7 years to stepping into engineering leadership roles. My experience spans across a spectrum of companies, from MNCs to startups, which has equipped me with a well-rounded perspective on building and scaling technology.  In my current role, I‚Äôm focused on building next-gen AI solutions and a spectrum of tools that push the boundaries of innovation. I have a proven track record of setting up multiple codebases and projects from scratch, ensuring they are built to scale and serve millions of daily active users.  Starting my career as a frontend engineer, I developed a strong foundation in frontend technologies, which continues to influence my approach to creating user-focused, scalable solutions. Over the last 4 years, I‚Äôve been leading and growing engineering teams from the ground up, with a keen focus on hiring top talent and fostering high-performing teams.  As the founding engineer at Scaler, I‚Äôve had the privilege of building its tech ecosystem from scratch, designing systems that are future-ready and can handle scale. My contributions include scaling diverse products, such as GTM initiatives, the AI Companion, and tools that have redefined the learning experience and boosted sales efficiency using AI.  I‚Äôm passionate about using technology to solve complex problems, build impactful products, and empower teams to excel.
position_description_1: Building the next-gen AI learning companion and advanced AI tools to drive efficient sales strategies.  Currently managing and overseeing all things tech, including the AI Companion, the Student Dashboard for Scaler's paid customers, growth initiatives (V2L - View to Lead, L2P - Lead to Pay), GTM for Scaler School of Technology and Business  and an ecosystem of tools designed to empower the sales team.
position_description_2: ‚óè Collaborated closely with product managers to review product requirements, delivering maximum impact and output from various products, resulting in a 99.99% system availability. ‚óè Managed 6 Pods and a team of 25 members, optimizing processes and enhancing productivity. ‚óè Designed products from scratch, collaborating with design, leadership, business, and tech teams, leading to the highest revenue-generating product of Scaler. ‚óè Set up the process of hiring and onboarding approximately 500 interns, designed the Bootcamp for them ensuring they were up to speed from day one, and helped the tech team transition from 7 members to 80 efficiently by setting up the process of hiring. ‚óè Spearheaded the setup of the frontend codebase and built SEO websites, improving page speed and performance by 30%. ‚óè Contributed to various products from ideation to delivery, using tools like Cypress and Next.js, enhancing efficiency and user experience. ‚óè Built the design system for scaler improving the development and designing speed.
position_description_5: 1) Created a portal using Ruby on Rails and Vue.js to feed data to the Qubole website‚Äôs different verticals which was earlier done using database changes hence reducing the backend change and increasing productivity. 2) Created a what's new widget using Ruby on Rails and Vue.js for posting different company-wide updates and release of new features. 3) Creation of the role-based model to make different users have various access privileges. 4) Enhancing the UI of the qubole website by adding different ease of access modals for various example queries using JQuery and Vue.js.

summary: With over seven years of experience in machine vision and artificial intelligence, Abhishek is a product manager & technical consultant at Flutura (Part of Accenture), a leading provider of industrial analytics and AI solutions. He is also responsible for the product ownership and management of Cerebra Vision Intelligence Platform, a no-code computer vision toolkit for industrial engineers, workers, and managers.   Abhishek is passionate about transforming industrial processes and operations with cutting-edge machine vision and AI technologies. He has successfully deployed computer vision applications in various domains, such as retail, sports, manufacturing, healthcare, security, and defense. He has also designed and delivered computer vision courses on various platforms and published papers in renowned journals. He is a vocal speaker and writer on topics such as industrial machine vision, MLOps, ethical best practices, and learning roadmaps in AI. He has received multiple awards and honors, including the Most Influential Young Data Scientist by ISoDS and the Google Summer of Code Scholar.

summary: Hi, I‚Äôm Jatin, Founder & CTO at GoCodeo. I'm building intelligent systems that turn ideas into production-grade software - fast, modular, and developer-first.  At GoCodeo, I lead engineering, AI systems, and product strategy, unifying cutting-edge research with real-world scale. From designing AI codegen agents to architecting full-stack delivery pipelines, I work across the full stack of modern software creation.  With a foundation in AI, full-stack engineering and machine learning systems, I operate at the intersection of automation, intelligence, and developer experience turning raw ideas into shipping products in minutes.  GoCodeo highlights: ‚Ä¢ 30,000+ developer users from 200 global companies ‚Ä¢ 2000+ full-stack web apps shipped ‚Ä¢ 150 million lines of code generated and tested ‚Ä¢ 100+ integrations (GitHub, Vercel, Supabase, Notion, Slack, Jira etc.) ‚Ä¢ #1 on Product Hunt and featured by OpenAI ‚Ä¢ Raised $150,000 in pre-seed, backed by 100X, Google, Nasscom AI, IIMB NSRCEL, Accenture, and Rebalance  What I care about: AI coding agents, scalable infra, clean APIs, systems design, team velocity, ethical tech, and building fast. headline: Summer Inter @Ministry of Home Affairs  ||Pursuing B.Tech from Thapar University
summary: Hey there! I'm Paras Dang, born and brought up in Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh, and currently pursuing my B.Tech in Electronics and Computer Engineering at Thapar Institute of Engineering and Technology, Patiala. I‚Äôve always been passionate about technology and problem-solving, which led me to explore various domains like programming, data science, machine learning, and cybersecurity.  My journey began with a strong academic foundation‚Äî94% in CBSE Class 10 and 90% in Class 12‚Äîand has grown through hands-on experiences and internships. I‚Äôve developed strong proficiency in C++, Python, and HTML, and have a deep interest in data structures and algorithms, which I continue to hone through competitive coding and real-world applications.  During my internship at CoderOne, I worked on cutting-edge projects involving natural language processing, where I developed a user question answering system and a text summarization model using transformer-based architectures. These projects strengthened my understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and model fine-tuning.  Currently, I‚Äôm working with the Data Analytics Team at I4C (Indian Cybercrime Coordination Centre), where I contribute to analyzing critical datasets to support strategic decision-making in the field of national cybersecurity and crime prevention.  Apart from this, I‚Äôve also worked on robotics projects using Arduino and was honored to represent my district at IIT Roorkee in a tech event. I have a growing interest in emerging technologies like blockchain, cloud computing, and AI-powered automation, and I‚Äôm always looking for opportunities to apply my knowledge for meaningful impact.  I believe in continuous learning and am driven by curiosity, collaboration, and the desire to create solutions that matter.

In addition to my mobile development skills, I have experience with backend technologies such as Node.js (Sequelize ORM) and Python (FastAPI, SQLAlchemy), employing a Test-Driven Development approach to enhance code reliability and performance. position_description_1: At PropertyGuru, our mission is to empower people to make confident property decisions through relevant content, actionable insights, and world-class service. Scalability : Processes 10 million images monthly across SG, MY, VN & TH markets with 98 % correctness with turnaround time in few hours (FMOps) Cost & Time Optimisation : Saves 400 hours of manual review monthly, with 80 % reduction in processing & model inferencing cost using GenAI stack (Gemini in VertexAI)  2. The business outcomes include higher credit consumption and property agent participation in the marketplace with lower cost per action becoming a primary revenue generator for the company.  3. position_description_4: Building a conversational AI SaaS product to manage the end-to-end sales process  for enterprises. As a founding member of the ML practice in Salesken, have built and supervised the following use cases.  1. Search Engine : Building a semantic search engine which can match the customer utterances with relevant entities during a sales call and post call analysis so that the agent can serve the customer better. This search engine takes care of both symmetric and asymmetric matching, multi-lingual utterances, code switching and other nuances of a free-flowing conversation. This runs as an asynchronous ML Pipeline.  2. Signal Management System: This system onboards a customer with a minimal human intervention and within a span of 30 minutes (at max). The system takes customer inputs from a wizard and performs various NLU/NLI validations, domain adaptations (by industries) and generate variations using NLG models and persist them as entitles. Asynchronously it augments it with other information from web, documents and previous recorded calls from the CRM using techniques web-scraping, parsing and clustering .  3. Offline Generation of Cues : This system automatically creates/generates a set of questions and answers tuples for a given organization (B2B customer) using hierarchical knowledge graph, constrained text generation to generate various questions based on intentions/situations and using a reader and retriever model (machine comprehension) to retrieve the answers and persist them. This powers the real time cueing system.  4. ML Pipeline (MLOps) : These are asynchronous ML pipelines which execute about 20 Deep Learning models related to Customer Intelligence, Sales Intelligence and the Onboarding process. At a high level the ML pipeline consists of a Publisher and a Subscriber. The subscriber calls those 20 DL models which are running as FastAPI services. This mechanism is handled using callbacks and promises. The pipeline uses Kubernetes cluster and CI/CD using GCP
position_description_5: In continuation to the projects mentioned above, I have been working very actively and supervising the following modules -  5. Call Summarization Modules : A system of ML models which can summarize a conversation between the sales agent and the customer under certain categories namely Question Detection Model, (Dis)Agreement model, Objection Detection Model, Follow-up Action Detection Model, Conversational Adjacency Pairs (Dialog Act) models and Aspect Based Sentiment models. For sparsity of training data used Zero and Few-shot classifiers  6. Selling Best Practices Modules : A system of ML models which quantify the best practices shown by agents during the sales call. They are quantified using series of models for Agent Pitch Score, Conversational (Empathy) Grounding, Engagement Index and Win/Loss prediction model.  7. Multi-lingual Emotion Detection Model : From customer and agent utterances the system detected the emotions with a very high precision. A multi-lingual model XLM-R was fine-tuned on Go-Emotions English corpus and during inference performed a Cross Lingual Transfer on code-switched conversation snippets (Indic and English languages mixed). A lot of complexities are abstracted.  We published this as a paper titled "Curriculum learning for adapting models on Code-Mixed Data in Emotion Recognition" in COLING 2022 (International Conference on Computational Linguistics)  8. Model Optimization : As a continuous improvements to run the DL models in production, we keep optimizing these models using Knowledge Distillation both during Pre-training (Mini or Distil models) and during fine-tuning using Teacher - Student architecture (loss functions) , converting the computational graph into ONNX and running it on dedicated accelerator like ONNX Runtime (ORT) or TensorRT. Have been experimenting with NVIDIA Triton Inference Server, Model Repositories, Model Navigator, Model Analyzer and KServe (manages Triton Inference Server in Kubernetes cluster)
position_description_6: Data Scientist at MADS (Marketing Analytics & Data Science) team of Juniper Networks.  1. Built a content recommender (news & tech-specs documents) based on the customer multi-channel behavior based on semantic matches/searches using state-of-the-art deep learning models like Universal Sentence Encoder.  2. Built a chatbot to automate billing and sales related support using Neural Machine Translation (NMT) models by leveraging word vectors with the help of LSTMs (Long Short-Term Memory) in Encoder/Decoder architecture.  3. Built an end-to-end up sell and cross sell models based on customer intent, recency, product purchase and behavior.  4. Demand forecasting sales model for mid-market enterprises and different customer segmentation to be profitable.
position_description_7: As part of Verizon's Analytics group, I help the business solve Operations problem reducing the cost, improving Digital Channel mix and devising Market Strategy with the help of Data Science. I have also led teams on the Digital Strategy and Machine Learning initiatives.   1. Built a generalized Text Analytics Engine to improve customer‚Äôs online experience and improve the Digital Channel Mix using unstructured text data (customer chats, voice of customers & call notes). Applied models like Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA), Latent Semantic Indexing (LSI), Clustering and various NLP techniques.  2. Predict the FiOS (Verizon Fiber) penetration in the Boston Metropolitan Area for the roll-out plan using both supervised (regression models) and unsupervised (clustering, principal component analysis (PCA)) machine learning techniques.  3. Built a contract renewal model to address 1.7 million Verizon wireline contracts getting expired in 2016 using various classification techniques like logistic regression, and shape the offer and targeted marketing strategy.
position_description_8: I was doing independent research on the following areas of Econometrics & Machine Learning-   1. Discrete Choice problem using Market Simulation on a Computer Choice Study by performing Conjoint Analysis to predict individual consumer choice towards different Computer manufacturers. Estimated brand loyalty, price sensitivity, feature focus, brand switching and optimal pricing using Hierarchical Bayes (HB) MNL Logit model using Markov Chain Monte Carlo Estimation.  2. Optimal workforce estimation and scheduling for a call center of a bank with reference to a target wait-time, using Queueing model and to minimize the cost (constrained optimization problem) using Integer Linear Programming.  3. Facial Expression Recognition ‚Äì a multi class prediction model using Neural Network. Classified a 48 x 48 grayscale image of faces into seven different categories built from scratch (activation functions like RELU, Softmax, Hyperbolic Tangent, backpropagation using Gradient Descent, regularization techniques like Momentum & RMS Prop etc.)
position_description_9: 1. Built an entire CRM for a Dutch Telecom client in the area of Order to Cash, Sales-force, and Service-cycle modules.  2. Consultant for Wireless, Voice and Ethernet products of telecom clients in both consumer and business segments.
position_description_10: 1. Software Development for a telecom provider from the UK in their Operations and Business Support Systems.  2. Worked in Siebel CRM, Data Warehousing, SQL‚Äôs, scripting, workflows and webservice integrations.

headline: Founder at Ctruh | Building the World's First AI-powered Unified XR Commerce Studio
summary: Founder | Product Leader | XR Tech Evangelist  Hi, I‚Äôm Vinay Agastya- relentless builder at the intersection of next-gen commerce, immersive technology, and AI.  As Founder of Ctruh, I‚Äôm on a mission to democratize immersive experiences. We‚Äôre building the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Unified XR Commerce Studio: a web-native platform enabling brands to instantly create, manage, and launch stunning 3D, AR & VR experiences across all devices. From photorealistic fashion try-ons to interactive real estate walkthroughs, our no-code platform and AI-driven 3D engine are reshaping how people discover, engage, and shop online.  My journey began over a decade ago in high-growth startups: Swiggy, GenieBazar, Unacademy, and Exotel, building products and teams that scaled, delighted, and drove impact. At Scapic (acquired by Flipkart), leading growth gave me a front-row seat to XR‚Äôs transformative potential, inspiring my current pursuit: making immersive content simple, scalable, and truly accessible.  At Ctruh, we‚Äôve engineered innovations like VersaAI: our proprietary AI engine which seamlessly transforms everyday media (text, images, videos) into rich interactive 3D assets, all in minutes. The future of commerce is immersive, and we‚Äôre enabling bold brands to lead that future.  Areas of passion - Democratizing XR/3D/AR/VR for businesses of every size   - No-code tools and AI-powered content creation   - Product-led growth and crafting delightful experiences   - Building and mentoring ambitious, diverse teams  Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre passionate about shaping the future of XR, commerce, or want to chat about all things product, tech, and startups!
position_description_1: Building immersive 3D and XR experiences today is broken. Most businesses are forced to choose between outdated, bloated game engines like Unity and Unreal, or stitching together complex workflows that require heavy engineering, long timelines, and specialized hardware. The result? Beautiful ideas that never see the light of day, or worse, poor-quality experiences that don‚Äôt scale across browsers and devices.  That‚Äôs the problem we‚Äôre solving at Ctruh.  Ctruh is building the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Unified XR Commerce Studio, a web-native platform where brands can instantly create, manage, and deploy high-fidelity 3D and AR/VR experiences across web, mobile, and headsets. No apps. No code. No compromise on quality.  At its core is a proprietary 3D engine, built for real-time web rendering, and VersaAI, a generative AI that converts text, images, and videos into interactive 3D assets in minutes. From AI try-ons and 3D configurators to real estate walkthroughs and shoppable storefronts, Ctruh powers a new generation of XR commerce.  With unmatched browser performance and 4K‚Äì16K fidelity, we‚Äôre enabling businesses to go from static product pages to fully interactive experiences, in a matter of minutes.  We‚Äôre not just reducing friction. We‚Äôre redefining what‚Äôs possible.  We are live at: https://www.ctruh.com/

headline: Lead Data Scientist at Meesho | IIT KGP'18
summary: First and foremost, I love solving technical problems and learning new things. Most of them revolve around advancements in data sciences and software engineering.  With my first few internship experiences, I got the opportunity to apply NLP techniques on very interesting problem statements like chatbots and user query automation. I explored state-of-the-art methodologies and honed my machine learning skills while solving them. I naturally felt comfortable in data science, partly due to my majors in mathematics and computing from IIT Kharagpur.   Moving forward, I went on to extend my experience in the corporate world with Fractal Analytics, one of the industry leaders in data analytics services.  From quickly running experiments on my notebooks, I went on to write production-level code and develop MLOps architecture for the whole product at Eugenie.ai, a brainchild of Fractal Analytics. Being an early member of a startup, I got immense exposure in product development, data science, and software engineering. This is where I fell in love with taking sole ownership, building, and delivering quality solutions that create bottom-line impact.  While building Eugenie.ai, I got exposed to best practices for software engineering as well when we built the streaming data ingestion pipeline for sensors which involved writing pub-sub based services.   Running experiments on notebooks and using models in production are two entirely different things. I designed and implemented a full-fledged streaming big-data analytics service which involved creating a scalable MLOps architecture discussed in detail here.  https://eugenie.ai/ai-mlops-deep-learning-models-for-real-time-analytics/  Post Eugenie, I started working with Trell on personalising their user's video feed where we have achieved ~40% improvement in engagement till date.  Here are my core hands-on skills:  Data Engineering: Apache Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Sqoop, Spark, Flink, Kafka, Airflow  DataStores/Databases : HDFS, MySQL, Bigquery, MongoDB, DocumentDB, TimeScaleDB, Redis, MilvusDB  Data Analysis: SQL, Excel, Statistics Data Science: Recommender Systems, Time series, NLP MLOps: Kubernetes, Docker, Shell, Vim, Sentry, Prometheus, Grafana, Kubeflow, Mlflow, Databricks, AWS Sagemaker  Cloud: AWS ¬ª Azure > GCP  Connect with me for any data science related discussions here => https://topmate.io/utkarsh_agrawal

headline: Data science at Meesho | NITR'21
summary: As a Data Scientist at Meesho, I work on developing scalable machine learning solutions to enhance product discovery through personalized ranking and recommendation systems. My primary focus lies in addressing the cold start problem for new  products, ensuring efficient onboarding and engagement from the outset. I design and optimize exploration algorithms that balance relevance with novelty, enabling users to discover high-quality, diverse content. By leveraging advanced statistical modeling, user behavior analytics, and real-time data pipelines, I contribute to building robust recommendation infrastructure that drives user retention, conversion, and overall platform growth.
position_description_1: 1. Designed and deployed ML- and DL-based recommendation systems to improve product discovery, with a focus on solving the cold start problem for new products. 2. Developed explore strategies using reinforcement learning and representation learning techniques to enhance user engagement through relevant and diverse content exposure. 3. Engineered multi-objective ranking models that optimize for CTR, conversion, and content diversity using deep neural networks, product embeddings, and sequence-aware models. 4. Built real-time pipelines and inference systems enabling low-latency recommendations and personalized feeds across the Meesho app ecosystem.  Key Projects: 	1.	FY Feed CTR-Based Ranker: Developed a deep learning-based click-through rate prediction model to optimize the FY feed ranking. Utilized user-product interaction features, session embeddings, and attention-based architectures to drive engagement and conversions. 	2.	Search Real-Time Sequence-Based Ranker: Built a sequence-aware ranking model for Meesho search, leveraging transformer architectures and user action sequences. Enabled real-time personalization by integrating historical session data with product representations.
position_description_2: 1. We launched Explore ML ranker for new onboarded products. This construct resulted 2x jump in orders and views contribution and gave better visibility of new products on FY-feed and PDP. (LTR, LightGBM, Pyspark, Python, AWS)  2. Made a user personalized feed on Homepage for explore products using candidate generation. This model improved explore GMV and Vc. (Real time Candidate generation, Pyspark, ML)  3. Catalog ranking offer infra : Platform wide created a single Spark model for sale and deals offers which is being  used by data science, tech, and product teams for the application of Ml ranking, Auto boosting and CLP pre-indexing. This model is  being used  by 7 different charters and easily adaptable for future use cases like offer - prediction, discount depth etc.  4. Supply Deals Modelling : Created a dynamic model for 3 hour deals construct which was for 24 hours before. This model can easily track 14 different metrics to track deals performance easily. This model can easily track DOD metrics if something is breaking.  5. Sale Inventory supply modelling : created a dynamic inventory dashboard for Sale inventory. This dashboard has made a huge impact in terms of predicting inventory on the sale days and helped suppliers to get the maximum conversion.

headline: DS @Meesho Ex -LinkedIn | Airbnb | Mu Sigma | MBA(IIFT)| COEP
summary: I am currently working as Insights Program Manager in  Sales Tooling and Scaled Insights team at LinkedIn, where we are dedicated to developing cutting-edge tools and insights for our pre and post-sales processes across various LinkedIn products such as LinkedIn Talent Insights, LinkedIn Jobs, and LinkedIn Learning.  In this influential role, I oversee a highly skilled data science team, driving complex data science projects and fostering close partnerships with cross-functional teams including sales, data engineers, and software engineers. By leveraging evidence-based strategies and delivering results-oriented qualitative and quantitative insights, I play a crucial role in shaping platform strategies.  On a day-to-day basis, I am responsible for building, scaling, and maintaining metrics, dashboards, and sales tools that cater to a wide range of users and functions. I delve into vast datasets, unearthing valuable trends and key insights that drive the success of our sales initiatives. Furthermore, I serve as a vital link between business, product design, UI/UX, and our multi-functional engineering teams, ensuring efficient delivery of high-quality technical implementations.  Collaboration is at the core of my work, as I partner closely with the sales team and engineering department to define data collection, reporting requirements, metrics, and aggregates for analysis, ETLs, reporting, experimentation, and machine learning. Additionally, I collaborate with business, marketing, product, and executive teams, generating regular presentations and leading impactful QBR, WBR, and MBR sessions.  With my strong analytical skills, encompassing SQL, Python, and/or R for big data analysis and modeling, along with expertise in statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design, I am equipped to tackle complex challenges and drive data-informed decision-making.  Overall, my role allows me to make a significant impact by spearheading innovative solutions, leveraging data insights, and collaborating with diverse teams to drive the success of our sales initiatives at LinkedIn.

headline: Community Manager & Dev Advocate at Mirantis | CNCF Ambassador | Ex-LitmusChaos Community Manager | KCD Bengaluru Organiser | Platform Engineering Meetup Co-Organizer | Previously at Harness, ChaosNative, MayaData
summary: As a Community Manager and Developer Advocate at Mirantis, I lead initiatives for the Open Source Program Office, supporting projects like k0s, k0rdent, k0smotron, and other open-source technologies. My role involves fostering collaboration between internal teams and external communities, driving engagement strategies, and ensuring alignment with open-source principles. With a focus on community growth, I manage interactions, organize targeted programs, and facilitate contributions across global developer ecosystems.    Over the past 4.5 years, I have specialized in scaling DevOps and Chaos Engineering communities, including leading LitmusChaos and formalizing open-source directives at Harness. These experiences have honed my skills in strategic planning, advocacy, and community analytics. As a CNCF Ambassador, I actively contribute to mentorship programs and global events, promoting collaboration and innovation within the cloud-native ecosystem. My mission is to empower developers and organizations through open-source community building and impactful engagement.
position_description_1: After 4.5 years of leading the LitmusChaos Community, I am excited to announce that I am joining Mirantis as a Community Manager & Dev Advocate to help build the Open Source Community at Mirantis supporting k0s, k0smortron, k8s Cluster Api, Mirantis Open Stack communities.  My responsibilities include:  Project Management: Leading and coordinating internal open source development teams, ensuring alignment with company goals and open source community standards. - Community Engagement: Managing the interaction between internal teams and external open source communities, fostering collaboration and contribution. - Strategic Planning: Developing and implementing strategies for effective participation in open source projects and communities, with a focus on Kubernetes and related technologies. - Community Management: Directly managing smaller strategic open source communities, nurturing growth and fostering a positive environment. - Metrics and Reporting: Track and report on key performance indicators related to open source engagement and project progress. - Conflict Resolution: Mediating and resolving conflicts between internal teams and external community members when necessary. - Outreach: Representing the company at open source events, conferences, and online forums to build relationships and promote the company‚Äôs open source initiatives. - Compliance: Ensuring all open source contributions and usage comply with relevant licenses and company policies. - Strategy Development: Working with the OSPO leadership to develop per community/project strategies. - Relationship Building: Develop relationships within these communities/projects to help us succeed in our strategic goals
position_description_2: Formalised the Open Source and Product Community Directives and Management (Chaos Engineering, Feature Flags, Cloud Cost Management) Worked with the internal developer teams to drive community activities and resolve community questions Collaborated with various leaders and teams to curate product-specific community programs and engagements Coordinated with marketing and content team to drive community engagement Authored several community-centric and product-related blogs and articles Curated, managed and analysed community performance reports and metrics (Google Analytics, Scarf) Evangelised and advocated project and community at various conferences as a speaker (AWS Days, KubeCon, GDG Cloud, Kubeday, KCDs) Managed Community Documentation and News Managed the CNCF community presence for Harness Organised community events, meetups, and webinars throughout the year Strategised and Formulated the community content program and professional certifications to facilitate outreach Helped design graphics, create videos and author content to engage and promote project outreach
position_description_4: Chaos Native is an early leader in open source cloud-native Chaos Engineering with intentions to further accelerate the pace of innovation as an independent company, working closely with users and maintainers in the LitmusChaos community. LitmusChaos offers a complete toolset for cloud-native SREs and developers to practice Chaos Engineering and helps build the overall resilience of applications and platforms of the ecosystem. Check out Chaos Native at: https://www.chaosnative.com/
position_description_5: At MayaData, as a community manager, my role was to curate community outreach programs for the LitmusChaos project which is mainly based on cloud-native Chaos Engineering used to carry out Chaos Tests in Kubernetes Systems. The outreach programs included organizing community meetings as well as Kubernetes Chaos Engineering meetups.  Furthermore, it involved facilitating integrations with other projects and open source technologies in accordance with the need of the community as well as the growing market. I was also responsible for carrying out social media campaigns and handling the LitmusChaos social media posts, its growth, and identifying leads. Other than that my role was inclusive of catering to community needs and requirements by indulging in dialogue and creating a communication channel between the community and the technical team. Community management also involves logistical delivery of organizing blogs, podcasts, articles, interviews, etc.

I‚Äôm currently the Senior Director of Data Science at Meesho‚ÄîIndia‚Äôs largest social commerce platform‚Äîwhere I guide a team building next-gen search and recommender systems, driven by GenAI (Transformers, LLMs) and deep learning.**       **Current Focus**   üî∏ Leading a talented data science team at Meesho to design high-impact AI/ML products.   üî∏ Championing a research-oriented culture for continuous innovation in ranking, user journey optimization, and reinforcement learning.   üî∏ Aligning AI initiatives with broader business goals, creating real-world impact through measurable user engagement and revenue gains.       **Previous Stints**   üî∏ **Flipkart, Hike Messenger, Clip**: Built and scaled ML solutions around Fraud detection, social messaging and video products that powered better user experiences and fueled exponential business growth.   üî∏ **Goldman Sachs (Banking)**: Leveraged advanced analytics to optimize risk management, drive operational efficiency, and support mission-critical financial strategies.       **What Drives Me**   üî∏ Pushing the boundaries of GenAI, LLMs, and deep learning to unlock novel solutions.   üî∏ Driving organizational and product strategy through cross-functional collaboration.   üî∏ Sharing knowledge and contributing to the broader AI community through thought leadership and exploration.       **Let‚Äôs Connect**   I love discussing AI strategies, cutting-edge ML research, and data-driven transformations. If you‚Äôre passionate about harnessing data for exponential business impact, feel free to reach out‚ÄîI‚Äôm always excited to learn, collaborate, and explore new frontiers in AI.

headline: Founder, Herody (Bootstrapped to 10 Cr+ Revenue) | Angel investor | Marketer
summary: Transforming the landscape of digital marketing and brand growth, one student at a time. I'm Rajdeep Sinha, a relentless innovator at the intersection of youth empowerment and cutting-edge marketing strategies.  My journey from the heartlands of Bihar to pioneering a marketing revolution across India embodies the spirit of entrepreneurship and the power of organic growth. As the founder of Herody, I've orchestrated a paradigm shift in how brands connect with their audience, leveraging the untapped potential of India's vibrant student community.  Core Expertise: Organic Growth Hacking Content Marketing & Storytelling Influencer Marketing & Micro-Influencer Campaigns Community-Driven Marketing College Ambassador Programs Guerrilla Marketing & Offline Brand Activations Social Media Strategy & Execution Performance Marketing Brand Positioning & Market Penetration  During my college years, I collaborated with 40+ brands, mastering the art of viral marketing and audience engagement. This experience catalyzed the birth of Herody ‚Äì now a thriving ecosystem of 3 Lakh+ student brand ambassadors, driving explosive growth for over 300 clients nationwide.  What sets my approach apart?  A unique alchemy of grassroots student networks and sophisticated organic growth strategies ‚Äì a combination rarely seen in the Indian marketing landscape. This innovative model has allowed Herody to flourish as a bootstrapped success story, consistently delivering ROI-driven results for businesses of all sizes.  I'm on a mission to democratize student marketing opportunities while providing brands with unparalleled access to Gen Z insights and engagement. My passion lies in crafting bespoke growth strategies that blend digital innovation with on-ground activation, resulting in campaigns that not only go viral but also drive tangible business outcomes.  Whether you're a scrappy startup looking to disrupt your industry, an established brand aiming to reconnect with younger audiences, or a fellow marketer passionate about the future of digital engagement, I'm always eager to exchange ideas and explore collaborations.  Let's connect and explore how we can harness the power of youth-driven marketing to skyrocket your brand's growth. Together, we can create campaigns that don't just capture attention ‚Äì they ignite movements.

position_description_6: ‚Ä¢ Developed a Model to detect the working status of Chimney and the Condenser from the satellite images and classify them as  working Chimneys, Non-Working Chimneys, Working Condensing Towers and Non-Working Condensing Towers. ‚Ä¢ Used ESR-GAN Model for generating the super resolution images and further used Faster-RCNN and YOLO V8 Model for  detecting above classes and creating bounding boxes around them. ‚Ä¢ Further Enhanced the accuracy by using Height Filtering and Direction Filtering (using PCA), thus removing false positives like   building, towers, roads and trees that were missed classified as chimneys.

summary: I am a Data Scientist with 2+ years of industry experience and 2 years in academia, specializing in deep learning, NLP, and computer vision. My expertise spans LLMs, AI agents, RAG, LoRA, and model optimization, with applications in autonomous systems, recommendation engines, and generative AI.  Previously in Mercedes-Benz R&D, I have worked on object classification, large-scale data pipelines, model optimization (QAT, TensorRT), and LLaMA-based AI agents. I utilize Kotlin, Java, Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Docker, Kubernetes, GraphQL, and REST APIs to create scalable, secure, and responsive applications that align with business goals and enhance user experience.  With 7+ years of experience in software development, I have a strong background in Java, Spring Boot, Kotlin, React.js, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap. My previous projects include converting a monolithic app to a microservices architecture using Spring Boot and AWS SQS, creating a user-friendly onboarding website for digital marketing, developing a web-based application to evaluate employee performance, and building a ticketing tool for change requests. I am adept at delivering high-quality code, adhering to best practices in object-oriented analysis and design, test-driven development, and microservices architecture.  I hold a Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Science from KLE Society's College of Engineering and Technology. I am excited to contribute to Oportun's mission of empowering financial inclusion and look forward to growing with the company.

headline: AI & Tech @Meesho | Ex-Airtel Digital | Masters from NUS, Singapore | Tech | AI | Scalable Systems | Data & ML Platforms
summary: I am a technology leader passionate about building AI-driven applications and scalable platforms using modern architectures. With deep expertise in backend engineering, cloud-native systems, and AI integration, I specialize in solving complex problems through robust, distributed systems.  I excel at designing and scaling microservices architectures with technologies like Spring Boot, Kafka, Redis, ScyllaDB, Dragonfly, Docker, and Kubernetes. My experience spans building high-throughput, low-latency systems in e-commerce and telecom, with strong exposure to REST, SOAP, and event-driven architectures.  In the AI domain, I am actively working on Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines, LangChain-powered LLM applications, and production-grade LLMOps infrastructure for real-time and batch inference. I have hands-on experience with vector databases, semantic search, and architecting AI workflows that integrate structured data systems (MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch) with LLM-powered reasoning layers.  Cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and DevOps automation (CI/CD) are integral to my development lifecycle. I am well-versed in TDD methodologies using JUnit and Mockito, and excel in cross-functional collaboration with business and technical stakeholders.  With a solid foundation in Java, Python, and modern web frameworks (ReactJS, AngularJS), I bring end-to-end system design expertise ‚Äî from backend performance tuning to AI-driven product features.  Technical Focus Areas:  AI & LLMOps: RAG, LangChain, LLMOps, Vector Search  Backend & Distributed Systems: Java, Spring Boot, Kafka, Redis, ScyllaDB, Dragonfly, Microservices, AOP, Hystrix, Camel  Databases: Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Aerospike  Cloud & DevOps: AWS, GCP, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD Automation  Frontend & Data: ReactJS, AngularJS, Apache Spark, OpenCV
position_description_1: As a member on the engineering team at Meesho, the leading e-commerce platform for Tier 2/3 India, I am honored to be a part of a company that is dedicated to democratizing internet commerce for everyone, including millions of small businesses and the next 500 million Indians who have recently come online.  I have the privilege of leading the User Growth Organization, a talented team of 15 developers who are focused on driving user acquisition, activation, engagement, and loyalty through a mix of continuous iteration and bold bets. By leveraging our collective expertise and innovative thinking, we are working towards achieving our ambitious growth targets and revolutionizing the e-commerce landscape in India.
position_description_2: I had the opportunity to work on building live commerce, which is a revolutionary concept in the e-commerce space. Through live commerce, consumers can interact with a seller or a brand in real-time through live video and make purchases directly from the video.  I was responsible for developing and implementing various features, such as live chat, product demos, and real-time payments, that facilitated a smooth and interactive shopping experience for users. I also worked on improving the scalability and reliability of the platform to ensure that it could handle a high volume of users and transactions.
position_description_3: During my time at Airtel Digital, one of the leading telecom operators in the world, I had the privilege of working on a variety of sales and distribution applications. My work included developing, designing, and implementing various features to enhance the user experience, increase sales, and streamline distribution processes. In addition to sales and distribution, I also had the opportunity to work on user acquisition platforms both based on aadhaar and non-aadhaar for Prepaid, Postpaid, Broadband and DTH.  One of my proudest accomplishments at Airtel Digital was building multiple highly scalable platforms from scratch. This involved working with a team of developers to design and develop platforms that could handle a high volume of users and transactions while ensuring reliability and security. I was responsible for leading the development process, ensuring that we delivered a product that met the needs of our users and exceeded their expectations.  Working at Airtel Digital was an incredible experience that allowed me to develop my skills as a developer and a leader.
position_description_4: On a sabbatical to pursue a Masters degree at the National University of Singapore (NUS). This opportunity has allowed me to deepen my knowledge and skills in my field and gain exposure to new technologies and ideas.  In addition to coursework, I am also involved in various research projects, working closely with faculty and other researchers to explore new areas of study and develop innovative solutions to real-world problems.
position_description_7: I had the opportunity to work on building big data pipelines. This involved developing and implementing a robust and scalable infrastructure for collecting, processing, and analyzing large amounts of data. I used technologies such as Apache Flink, Kafka, Debezium, Redis, ES, RocksDB for the implementation.
position_description_9: I had the opportunity to build an end-to-end project management tool, similar to Jira, entirely from scratch. This involved designing and developing a platform that could effectively manage and track projects and tasks, as well as provide a range of features to enhance team collaboration and productivity.

summary: ‚óè	Data Scientist with 6+ Years of total IT work experience in Amadeus Software Labs. ‚óè	A blend of Data Science and Software Engineering, capable of end to end development of Machine Learning models. ‚óè	Over 4+ years of work experience as Data Scientist having expertise in Machine Learning, Time Series Forecasting, predictive modeling, data analysis, Statistical modeling, data mining, big data development. ‚óè	Extensive hands-on experience of using Python Programming including numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, scipy, statsmodels, matplotlib, seaborn modules along with exposure to Tensorflow module for solving business problems using advanced Machine learning and Forecasting techniques. ‚óè	Hands on Expertise in Software Development with expertise in Algorithms, Data Structures, OOPs, Python Programing. ‚óè	Hands on Expertise in Supervised Problem (Regression and Classification) such as Linear/Logistic Regression, KNN, Decision tree (CARTs), Random Forest, Adaboost, Gradient Boosting, XGBoost, Light GBM and Unsupervised Problem (Clustering) such as KMeans, Hierarchical Clustering. ‚óè	Hands on Expertise in Time Series Forecasting Models such as SARIMAX, Exponential Smoothing and working knowledge on frameworks like Facebook Prophet. ‚óè	Analyzed and processed complex data sets using SQL queries and created reports and dashboards using Data Visualization tools like seaborn, plotly. ‚óè	Working knowledge in Apache Spark and building big data applications using Spark via Scala APIs. ‚óè	Productionized ML models by following best programing practices including Test Driven Development.
organization_title_2: Member Of Technical Staff - Data Scientist
position_description_2: ‚Ä¢	Adapted the existing models to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 on the airline industry and improved the MAPE from 35% to 17%. ‚Ä¢	Worked closely with the product team to build an airline fare prediction model using Neural Network with an overall MAPE value of 15%. ‚Ä¢	Developed a big data application using Scala-Spark to parse around 40k files daily and extract information about flight delay in 15 minutes. Also added the capability of historical reprocessing and optimized the application to process entire year in an hour. Entire work from Design to Code was managed by me. ‚Ä¢	Developed basic interactive dashboards and charts using Seaborn, Plotly to explain the trends and recovery in airline industry from the impact of COVID-19. ‚Ä¢	Conducted and lead the Amadeus wide data science contest in 2021, starting from the formulation of the problem, evaluation metrics till the final jury round. ‚Ä¢	POC on Passenger Segmentation using Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and K-Means Clustering.
position_description_3: ‚Ä¢	Implemented and productionized a generic passenger forecasting model using Time Series Forecasting Techniques such as SARIMAX, Exponential Smoothing for 25k different time series with overall MAPE of 10%. Used parallel processing to reduce the processing time by 15x. ‚Ä¢	Involved in building a model based on the Gradient Descent algorithm to come up with true airline passenger count across the world with a MAPE of 6% at leg/leg-airline level. ‚Ä¢	Implemented and productionized a mathematical model from scratch to come up with connecting passengers share at an airport using Curve Fitting. ‚Ä¢	Developed many ETL and Data Processing tasks using pandas and numpy. ‚Ä¢	Mentored an intern and provided guidance in building Quality Check Dashboards. ‚Ä¢	Built an interactive validation dashboard using R-Shiny with quick response time even for a large dataset. ‚Ä¢	Owned the Python Web Services after getting handover of the product and implemented new features using Flask.
position_description_4: ‚Ä¢	Worked on Ruby on Rails Web Services as a single developer from the local site with best software practices such as Test-Driven Development. ‚Ä¢	Developed a common Web Services component to achieve scalability of the product. ‚Ä¢	POC for new Scalatra Web Services technology and involved in the implementation of the foundation of the same.

headline: Co-founder at GetCrux - AI Creative Strategist | YC
summary: I think marketing & advertising at it's core is about figuring out what people want. That's a pretty hard problem to solve. It takes both art and science, sometimes even a bit of guesswork to get it right.  Nobody can get it right all the time, but we can tighten our process to improve the odds.   That's what we're trying to do at GetCrux - helping you learn faster from creative tests, finding patterns and signals in how users are responding to your ads, and make better creative decisions.  -------- Previously, I studied renewable energy at IIT Bombay where (in between having the time of my life) I got some work done too.  I worked on Mood Indigo which was like a scaled-down version of Coachella where we hosted thousands of college students, Indian and international artists and celebs for a 4-day long festival in December at the IIT Bombay campus. In 2020, we did an online metaverse-like version which was a different twist. headline: Senior Data Scientist @ Meesho | AdsTech : Experimentation : Geospatial ML
summary: I am an experienced senior data scientist with a proven track record in the e-commerce and finance sectors.  My career in data science began in the home finance industry, where I specialized in leveraging data analytics to effectively manage credit and mitigate fraud risk. Later, I joined India's first profitable horizontal e-commerce platform, where I developed a deep understanding of using data science to build an Ads Supply Platform aimed at maximizing platform revenue while maintaining user experience and seller ROI. Currently, I am driving the Experimentation Platform Strategy and Execution from the data science side at Meesho, with the business goal of onboarding all feature experiments and providing accurate and quick results.  I hold a Post Graduate Diploma in Business Analytics, a prestigious program jointly offered by three of India's top institutions: IIT Kharagpur, IIM Calcutta, and ISI Kolkata. I also earned a Bachelor of Engineering degree from VJTI, Mumbai University.
position_description_1: Currently, I am part of two pods - Geo-Infra and Experimentation Platform!  In Geo-infra pod, as a foundational piece, we are building best in class geocoding models for Indian addresses. Second layer of intelligence is built using optimisation in logistic resource planning.   We are also building experimentation platform to cater all AB experiment getting conducted in Meesho. We constantly shipping statistical features to help us conduct experiment in quickest and most accurate way.  Earlier, I had worked in Ads Supply Platform, where we are maximising revenue meeting user experience and seller ROI guardrails. We developed optimised Bidding Strategies, Dynamic Ad Exposure Algorithm, Budget Pacing and much more.  About Meesho:  Meesho stands at the forefront of India's rapid internet commerce growth, committed to democratizing online business opportunities. Our vision is to empower 100 million small businesses and individual entrepreneurs across India, enabling them to thrive in the digital marketplace.

headline: Democratizing Internet Commerce for Bharat!
summary: About me: - 11+ years of engineering leadership experience - 16+ years of industry experience across product, platform, infrastructure, ads, embedded, and analytics teams. - 3 years in the ridesharing space across marketplace, vehicle solutions and advertising tech. - 3 years of TV, Video, Ads, Analytics, BigData, ISP and Cable service - 6 years of core Linux kernel (IO scheduling, disk IO, memory management) and system software experience - 4 years of Cluster Management software stack experience
position_description_4: I lead multiple teams on Assistant Infrastructure. We work on the core infrastructure components that enables our product team to build quickly for new use cases for the Assistant and scale easily to provide our users a natural and reliable assistant experience.  Collectively, my teams are responsible for: * The core Assistant serving platform, its reliability and long-term architectural design and evolution * Managing the state and context of the conversation, in the presence of concurrent requests and multiple devices * Moving the assistant server platform to micro-services to improve maintainability and developer experience on the platform * Scaling Assistant features to work seamlessly across all devices by providing the right abstractions for feature developers while allowing for device specific tweaks * Execution and dispatch of the end user task (mutating the state of the world) across various execution targets * The core communication protocol that Assistant devices and the server stack uses to communicate the user request, response and actions
position_description_5: I moved to Bangalore, India to help grow the Uber Bangalore site where I lead the Vehicle Solutions team. We build the driver-partner on boarding flows and third party integrations (rentals and financier companies) that result in a vehicles marketplace for drivers to choose from when they want to drive on the Uber platform but don‚Äôt have or can‚Äôt afford to buy a vehicle. We built a Rentals Platform API to scale this worldwide and expand our marketplace choices for our driver partners.   I also bootstrapped a new AdTech data and measurement charter out of Bangalore. This is AdTech on the buy side - where Uber is the advertiser and we‚Äôre working on optimizing our marketing spend and improving our acquisition and engagement ROI.
position_description_6: I grew and led the Marketplace Health team whose mission is to ensure Uber‚Äôs markets are healthy and operating at maximum network efficiency. This involved coming up with independent ways to evaluate the health of the marketplace (reliability and efficiency metrics), aligning the tech and ops orgs around those metrics and helping them improve health in their cities.   The team built metrics pipelines and data visualization tools for analysis, complicated data science models and execution at scale to simulate flow of cars to identify maximum efficiency, and alerting algorithms and tools for ops teams when health was critical.
organization_title_7: Engineering Manager / Senior Staff Engineer - Google Fiber
position_description_7: Started as an Engineering Manager by bootstrapping the TV Ads and Analytics teams. Over the ~3 years, we grew to a 27+ group of engineers and PMs.  TV Ads: - We build one of the first realtime TV ad insertion systems at the set-top box level, so every user in theory can be shown a different ad depending on their profile and interest. - Ventured into other potential ad offerings for non-live content  Analytics: - We built the analytics for all of TV and Internet products - We built ML models for understanding customer interests, churn risk, etc.
organization_title_8: Staff Engineer - Linux Kernel and Cluster Management
position_description_8: We built containers before Docker and Mesos were a thing!  I worked on the Linux Kernel team for our servers, and among other things built: 1. A prioritized IO scheduler before CFQ became the default Linux IO scheduler. 2. A proportional IO scheduling mechanism that is now part of the CFQ IO scheduler (works with cgroups) 3. Memory containers - including anonymous, pagecache, kernel, slab, and more as part of the memory cgroup accounting mechanisms. Rolled out memcg @ Google! 4. Testing harnesses for our large scale applications (before we roll out a new kernel there)  I also worked on the memory management layer for Google's cluster management solution. We completely revamped how Google binaries share memory resources on our servers!
position_description_9: Intern with the CrawlIndex SRE team working on extending Linux Kernel to support a prioritized IO scheduler. This work then made its way to the production kernel team at Google, as I joined them fulltime in 2007.

He is currently pursuing a doctorate in Generative AI and holds an MTech in AI from BITS Pilani. Throughout his career, Sachin has excelled in stakeholder management, AI team leadership, and the development of innovative AI solutions. His ambition is to leverage his extensive expertise to design and deploy cutting-edge AI technologies that solve key business problems and drive organizational success. He has a proven track record of delivering impactful AI projects across various domains and is passionate about continuous learning and advancement in AI technologies.  Currently, Sachin is a Engineering Manager , AI at Helpshift. He is responsible for embedding Gen AI, AI agent , NLP, LLM, and data-driven decision-making in core business processes, as well as developing new products to help customers meet their course creation needs. Sachin leads a team of senior data science engineers, design thinkers, data scientists, and domain experts, and frequently innovates and pitches ideas to grow the appliance business further. He also mentors and empowers his team members to define and execute their strategies and goals. Sachin own ~50 linkedIn Recommendations for his delivered value to company and people.   In past, He worked on a project like Survival analysis for a heart attack patient at one of Pune hospitals. Attrition customer modelling in finance business and content curation using NLP in Ed tech Business.   His mission is to help people and organizations in their AI journey and to create AI-enabled products that solve real-world problems.   Sachin enjoys pursuing hobbies, which include singing, playing the guitar, reading, and travelling. So far he has composed 7+ compositions. Sachin lives in Pune with his wife and three-year-old son, and his hometown is Gwalior, MP.

organization_title_1: Analytics Team Lead  - Product Ranking/Data Science
position_description_1: As the Analytics Lead for Core Ranking at Meesho, I'm focused on making e-commerce accessible and intuitive for users across Bharat. I lead data-driven strategies that shape how millions of customers discover products, ensuring our platform understands and serves their unique needs.  My key focus areas include:  Search That Understands Bharat: Building a search experience that decodes complex, multi-language, and even misspelled search queries to make finding the right product effortless for every user.  Simplified Product Discovery: Making it easier for customers to explore our vast catalog by showing relevant substitute products and complementary items at the right moments, simplifying their decision-making process.  Real-Time Personalization: Creating a dynamic shopping feed that adapts in real-time to a user's clicks and searches within a single session, helping us capture their immediate intent and show them what they're looking for faster.  Deep Regional Personalization: Going beyond standard algorithms to integrate local trends, regional tastes, and demographic nuances into our core product ranking. This ensures the shopping experience feels familiar and relevant to all our customers, no matter where they are from.

In the Smartphones category, we evolved from budget devices to now selling iPhones and  marking a big leap in user trust and platform positioning. headline: Head - Product Security Engineering & Compliance
summary: Security Engineering Leader with 9+ years of experience building and scaling product security programs from the ground up. Proven track record of transforming security from a reactive function into a proactive, embedded discipline across SDLC, powered by automation, threat modeling, and secure design. Experienced across application security, infrastructure, cloud, and compliance. Currently exploring AI/ML security vectors including prompt injection and model exploitation in LLMs.  Currently leading Product Security at Meesho, one of India‚Äôs largest e-commerce platforms, where I built the security engineering team from inception to a 20-member unit covering Application Security, Infrastructure, DevSecOps, Compliance, and Threat Intelligence. I‚Äôve personally led and delivered security assessments for over 300 projects, driving significant risk reduction and enabling secure product velocity.  Recognized by leading organizations like Google, Amazon, Bugcrowd, PortSwigger, MakeMyTrip, etc. for responsible vulnerability disclosures through active participation in global bug bounty programs.  Core Competencies  - Security (Web, Android, iOS) - AI Security  - Secure SDLC & DevSecOps - Threat Modeling & Secure Architecture Reviews - Cloud Security (AWS, GCP) & WAF (Cloudflare, AWS & Akamai) - Network & Infrastructure Security - Red Teaming & Social Engineering (Vishing, Phishing) - Source Code Review & Automation - API & Thick Client Security Testing - Risk Assessments & Security Program Management - Fraud Detection & Prevention - Developer Training & Security Awareness - Compliance(ISO 27001 & TPRM)  Views expressed here are personal and do not represent the views of my employer unless explicitly stated.
position_description_1: Founding Member and Leader: Established and led the Security Engineering team, growing it from a nascent group to a robust team of 20 specialists covering diverse domains.  Proactive Security Initiatives: Pioneered and managed multiple security programs, including conducting Quarterly security assessments, integrating security review in release cycle, implementing a Bug Bounty Program, conducting Threat Modeling, Prd & Architecture Reviews, introducing Security On-Call rotations, performing Third Party Vendor Reviews, and working with cross org teams on Fraud Detection & Prevention.  Infra Security Enhancements: Optimized existing rules in AWS WAF and on-boarded a robust solution like Cloudflare & Akamai to ensure zero downtime caused by security attacks like DDoS and common OWASP attacks on websites.  Secure Coding Practices: Developed and enforced organization-wide secure coding guidelines to elevate code quality and adherence to industry standards.  Shift Left Program: Collaborated with cross-functional teams to integrate security technologies into the CI pipeline, advancing the Shift Left approach to security.  Security Awareness and Training: Conducted security training and awareness programs, including language-specific secure coding training and monthly security quizzes, fostering a security-aware culture and minimizing human error risks.  Threat Intelligence and Skill Development: Stayed abreast of emerging security threats and technologies, ensuring the organization remained protected, while providing mentorship and guidance to team members to advance their careers in security engineering.  Security Strategy Planning, Development and Alignment: Successfully creating and presenting security engineering team's OKRs to senior leadership, demonstrating alignment with organizational goals and showcasing measurable progress toward key milestones.
